Projects do so by adding themselves to this bug and each of the P1 bugs used to define "Must-Do" requirements for train participation.'

b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252791 +++\n\nProject representatives must attend the planning meetings and conference calls - you have to be involved to be involved.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252792 +++\n\nProjects must have a written ramp down policy by M6+0
column8: linked in the table above pending inclusion of ramp down element in the XML project plan. (One of the issues identified with this guideline is that its not so much the ramp down policy of how many votes are needed for each bug fix that we need to be consistent on
column9: but rather the meaning of each of the milestones and release candidates. See Platform 3.4 Endgame plan as a guideline. See also Galileo Final Daze.)'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252793 +++\n\nProjects must have their IP approved (a normal Eclipse requirement) and will follow the Eclipse Legal deadlines to do so. See also bug 220977.'

b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252795 +++\n\nProjects must use Eclipse message bundles unless there are technical reasons not to. (see Message Bundle Conversion Tool and [1])'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252796 +++\n\nProjects must use 4-part version numbers.'
b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252797 +++\n\nAll plug-ins (bundles) must use the true bundle form. That is
column8: provide a manifest.mf file
column9: and not rely on the plugin.xml file being 'translated' into a manifest.mf file at initial startup. See bug 130598. With that
column10: empty plugin.xml files in the presence of a manifest.mf file should not be included in a bundle."

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252798 +++\n\nAll plug-ins must correctly list their required JVM versions in the manifest.mf. See the wiki page about selecting the correct JVM.'

b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252799 +++\n\nProjects must use signed plugins using the Eclipse certificate. Exceptions must be authorized by the planning council for technical reasons.'

b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252800 +++\n\nProjects must use jar'ed plug-ins (with unpack=false) unless authorized by the planning council for technical reasons. Nested jars should be avoided if possible since it creates problems for projects that has dependencies to such plug-ins. The OSGi runtime is fine with it but the compiler is not able to handle classpaths that contain nested jars. In case only one nested jar exists
column8: it is often better to expand the contents of that jar into the root folder (i.e. unnest the jar). If a plug-in contains large files that are frequently used (opened and closed)
column9: a jar'ed plug-in might degrade performance significantly since the file must be decompressed each time it is opened."

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252801 +++\n\nProjects must have build process maturity: scripted
column8: repeatable
column9: and executable by others.'

column7: b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252803 +++\n\nAny new third-party plug-ins that are common between projects must be consumed via Orbit; the final Galileo release will not have duplicate third-party libraries (note that this only applies to identical versions of the libraries; thus if project A requires foo.jar 1.6 and project B uses foo.jar 1.7
column8: that's ok)."

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252804 +++\n\nProjects must optimize their own update site using pack200 to reduce bandwidth utilization and provide a better update experience for users. With the introduction of p2
column8: project update sites must generate metadata (artifact and content repository info).'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252809 +++\n\nMust use  ICU4J.'
b"In 3.2
column8: the lightweight system paints when it receives a native paint event.  However
column9: it's possible that this could happen when a figure is invalid -- after it's been invalidated but before the update manager performs validation.  This can cause several problems since figures usually don't expect to be painted when invalid.\n\nNot marking this bug as critical because whatever problems you run into would affect only that paint invocation.  And since an update has already been scheduled
column10: a follow-up layout and paint will occur soon after
column11: which means the user might not notice any problem visually.\n\nThis could be fixed by the update manager ignoring the native paint request if an update has already been scheduled
column12: or by forcing validation at that point."

column7:
b'The Undo (and Redo) menu items use the wrong undo context after the user switches workbench parts.  The incorrect operation history is presented to the user until the next undoable change is made in the diagram editor.

The problem is that the GlobalUndoAction (and GlobalRedoAction) creates a new Eclipse UndoActionHandler delegate whenever the workbench part changes.  In Eclipse 3.3M4 (see bug 162964) the UndoActionHandler has a 'contextActive' state that is false when a new handler is created.  The UndoActionHandler#getUndoContext returns the global undo context for the workbench until the its real context is deemed active.

Steps to reproduce the problem in the logic example:
1. Launch a new workbench and open the resource perspective
2. Create a simple project
3. Create an example logic diagram.  Observe that the undo menu item when the diagram is selected is "Undo New Project".
4. Add a new circuit to the diagram using the tool palette.  Now the undo menu item says "Undo Create Circuit"
5. Change focus to the Outline view
column8: then back to the diagram view.  Now the undo menu item is "Undo New Project". It should be "Undo Create Circuit"\n5. Create an LED using the tool palette.  Undo.  Observe that the undo menu item is correctly back to "Undo Create Circuit"'

column7: b'The autobuild feature is critical for people accustomed to using the JDT.  \nSupporting <ctrl>b build invocation is another compatiblity requirement.'

b"We should get all the necessary bridge methods 'for free' when compiling from
source - the MethodVerifier15 that we use knows about inherited ITDs and ITDs it
is receiving on any types it is verifying - so the logic to calculate when
bridge methods are required all gets driven correctly.

The problem is binary weaving - we've done nothing to ensure it works in this
case.  There seem to be a number of cases to consider and I'm not sure one
algorithm will fix them all...

If an ITD targets a particular class then it should be relatively easy when
applying that ITD to the class that you check for any inherited methods and
determine whether to create a bridge method representing the inherited methods
erasure...

The problem though is when you have a subclass below that which overrides the
method you are ITDing... it may be that a bridge method needs adding to the
subclass.  But we may not go and look at that subclass
column8: it may not be targetted\nfor weaving
column9:
is it reasonable to walk *down* a hierarchy from the type that has
been ITD'd upon?  If possible I'd probably try and use the existing munger
mechanism and create a munger that could be applied to the subtypes which adds
the bridge method...."

support

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252805 +++\n\nMust have new & noteworthy for each milestone. Must be something readable and usable not just a static list of all the bugs
column8: e.g. platform. Corollary: individual new & noteworthy should be linked in to the collective New & Noteworthy.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252806 +++\n\nThis means that users can load any subset of the Galileo projects into Eclipse and each of the loaded projects will pass all the same tests as if it had been loaded independently. If such a problem is identified
column8: the affected projects must fix the problem.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252809 +++\n\nMust use  ICU4J.'

b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252813 +++\n\nEach major project (the top-level projects except for the Tools and Technology projects where it is the sub-projects) should have an About dialog icon and contribute to the welcome page.'
b"If you don't consider this a bug
column8: call it a feature request."

this is an odd way

column7: b'ctrl-c
column8: ctrl-v
column9: ctrl-s
column10: F8
column11: step etc.\n\nNone of these work on Linux GTK.'

column7:
b'My first experience with the CDT was to take 20 source file from a Visual 
Studio/Win2K environment over to the CDT using Linux.

5 Files failed to open.  I got a message "This file is unreadable using the 
UTF8 character encoding".

So I took the 3 files back to my windows box and noticed that they had been 
saved as text.  I resaved the files as "dos text" instead of text and was then 
able to use the files in the CDT with Linux.'

column7: b"R4E keeps track of created reviews on each user group file
column8: \nhowever
column9: when a user is invited to other reviews and the userid is typed with e.g. a different case
column10: the user is treated as new and its file its overridden. \n\nSo re-opening the group will not load the reviews who don't have a creator."

column7:
b"I have added an action in the Team menu to create a patch file using CVS diff. 
The patch format is 'unified' with local addition showing (e.g. options -u -N 
to diff). When trying to apply this patch I get an invalid date error and a 
runtime exception. Please let me know if the patch file format is wrong. Or 
what diff options you expected to be used to create the CVS diff output.

Here is an example patch file that I have generated:

Index: bin/a.txt
===================================================================
RCS file: /home/jlemieux/workrepo/patch_example/bin/a.txt
column8:
v
retrieving revision 1.1
diff -u -r1.1 a.txt
--- bin/a.txt 19 Oct 2001 18:24:16 -0000 1.1
+++ bin/a.txt 22 Oct 2001 18:20:28 -0000
@@ -1 +1
column9:
2 @@
-sadfasdf
\ No newline at end of file
+sadfasdf
+ADDED L LINE

===================================================================
RCS file: src/newfile.txt
diff -N src/newfile.txt
--- /dev/null 1 Jan 1970 00:00:00 -0000
+++ src/newfile.txt 22 Oct 2001 18:20:28 -0000
@@ -0

column7:
b"Customer experiences compare timeout if the compare takes more than 20 seconds.
He wants to be bale to change timout value.
Cust Using 1.0

**************************************
We can reproduce this just comparing two local files.
So it appears to be the compare framework.

Ydo a diff on a file
column8:
and it pops up a dialog explicitly telling
you
about a 20 second time-out.  I'll repeat the exercise and post you the
dialog in a short while...

where does it tell you about the 20 sec ? window popping up ?

Very odd.  Where are you suggesting an error message might be present?
There are no other messages obvious in the UI
column9:
although I imagine there
might be some logged.

The reason it looked like a coded time-out is that it consistently tells us
that the diff took longer than 20 seconds and therefore was aborted (or
words to that effect).



Customer Said:
I'm using extssh and haven't experienced any problems with the same CVS
repository with other tools (at least nobody has reported any).

The diff engine timing out after 20 seconds does not seem right.  Is
there a way I can tweak this magic period (perhaps a property in some XML
somewhere)?  There's nothing I can find in the preferences to allow this to
be changed.


*****************************"

column7: b'There are number of cases where I would like to merge using copy/paste \noperations
column8: rather than the copy to left menu operation; but shortcuts \nare not supported which makes it highly error prone.'

column7:
b"Comparing two classes of the same name and package - can't tell which is which.

A class is being moved from one source folder to another and some code changes 
are being made as well.

I caught up with the incoming folder addition but did not accept the incoming 
folder deletion.

I selected both classes and did Compare With -> Each Other.

I have attached the screen shot of what the compare browser looks like - I 
can't tell which file is which."

b'Build 20011122.

I did the following:
- load org.eclipse.ui.tests from main stream
- selected test.xml under project
- chose Compare With / Patch
- used file prompter to choose patch file (see attached)
- hit Next
- hit Finish
- it gave me an error dialog with no message; the tile was truncated: "C..."

I noticed that the first time I tried
column8: the radio button for choosing a file \ninstead of the clipboard had not been selected.\nI tried it again.  This time it had remembered my patch file
column9: so the radio \nbutton was already selected.\nBut it gave me the same error the second time.'

column7:
b'If patch cannot apply a hunk to a workspace file it collects the hunks
into an file with the extension ".rej". This file is correctly shown in the
compare editor but it is not automatically saved to the workspace if the
compare editor is saved.'

b'[build 20011219]
The patch creation allows using the -N diff option to include new files in the 
generated patch. After the compare with patch matches the changes the compare 
editor shows the structure compare correctly
column8: however if you select an \naddition
column9: an internal error is shown in the compare editor.'

column7: b'When ever i do a sync with the build 20010115 i get <no-name> for every \ndirectory. \nI have downloaded the missing icons as far as i know.'
b"Build 20020115\n\n- with org.eclipse.ui source for v20020115 loaded
column8:
I selected the project and 
chose Compare With / Patch / (see attached patch)

- the compare editor showed 5 files with changes
- I selected each one and chose Copy Whole Document from Right to Left
- File / Save
- compared project with stream contents (or compare with v20020115 since I'm 
releasing these changes)
- no changes had been applied for one of the files (TasksFilter.java)
- double-checked that I had actually copied from right to left on this file in 
the compare editor -- I had
- this was the last file in the list
- had to go and apply the changes manually for this file

This is reproduceable.  I saw this last night at home
column9: and also this morning at \nwork."

column7:
b'I added a comment to the file TestSuitePanel from the JUnitSWT project located 
in the ZRH repository. After that I activated Replace from local history and 
the history entry has the following additional information "(Parse error)". 
First this is not very useful since it doesn't explain what the consequences 
are. I would like to see something like Parse error: no structure compare 
available. 

Additionally I don't understand why I get this message at all. The compilation 
unit doesn't even have a syntax error so why is it not parsable.'

navigator multi-select both files then choose "Compare With > Each Other". The 
compare view in shown but indicates that an internal error occured. If I rename 
the file from .#file.java1.2 to .#file.java the compare works fine.

column7: b"Let me begin by stating what we're trying to do.\nCompare With->Repository Contents is an ideal place to reconcile differences \nlocally. Simple changes are easy
column8: but additions and deletions are problematic. \nWe would like to be able to copy an addition or deletion right-to-left
column9: save
column10:
and have the resource created or deleted appropriately.

We identify at least two barriers to this:

1. In the addition case (where we have an existing repository node on the 
right and a non-existing resource node on the left)
column11: setContents() is not \ncalled on the node because
column12: for example
column13:
the compare text viewer checks if the 
resource exists before calling setContents().

2. In the case of copying a deleted remote file from right-to-left and saving
column14: \nwe cannot distinguish the empty content case from the deletion case. In both \ncases
column15:
setContents is passed a zero-byte array. We would like to have some way 
to tell the difference between these two cases.

If you have any suggestions about how this can be resolved (either by Compare
column16: \nor by us
column17: or both)

column7:
b"Context:
  - create a TextMergeViewer instance
  - set the input using an ICompareInput
  - make the left and/or right leg dirty
  - set the input using an IStreamContentAccessor as input for 
    the left and/or right leg of a new instance of ICompareInput

The expected behaviour is that the viewer will prompt the user
to save changes or to discard them.  This behaviour is controlled
by the sameDoc() method of TextMergeViewer which determines if the
IDocument instances associated with the left
column8: right
column9:
and ancestor
legs are the same for both the old input and the new input.

This method uses getDocument() for each leg
column10: which in the case of\nan IStreamContentAccessor input
column11: asks the DocumentManager for a\ncached working copy.  For the old input
column12: this is fine since the\nDocumentManager still contains the old working copy.  For the new\ninput
column13: however
column14:
this usually returns 'null' because no copy has
yet been cached.

So in this case sameDoc() will always return 'true' for each leg!
Hence the user will never be prompted to save changes and sometimes
they will be lost.

This is a serious issue for VCM because many of its components are
built around IStreamContentAccessors and exhibit the problem."

column7:
b"CompareEditorInput never reverts to being non-dirty unless
explicitly triggered by setDirty().  However client code
cannot reliably determine when the transition from dirty to
non-dirty should take place because they cannot access
the underlying viewers.

For instance
column8:
isSaveNeeded() will return 'true' even after
saveChanges(...) has been called.

Problems:
1) The dirty state listener does not check that the property being
   changed is actually dirtyness.  It must verify that the
   property name is CompareEditorInput.DIRTY_STATE.  At the moment
   it will be fooled by any other boolean property.

2) The dirty state listener should keep track of which viewers are
   dirty so that it can determine when the CompareEditorInput instance
   itself should be considered dirty/non-dirty.  The simplest solution
   is to add a viewer to a List when a DIRTY_STATE property change is
   received from it with value true
column9:
and to remove it from that List
   when a DIRTY_CHANGE property change is received from it with value false.
   isSaveNeeded() would then return true iff the list was empty.

3) findContentViewer() adds an extra SWT.Dispose event listener
   to the viewer's top-level control each time a viewer is recycled
   (not serious
column10: but wasteful)."

b"When using GTK 3.10 all views are empty. The problem is caused by a change in the way events are propagated.\nIn previous versions each GtkWidget with a gdkwindow got an expose event which gtk+ internally converted to emitting a draw signal then the widget had to propagate draw to any children that didn't have window.\nNow (3.10) instead a single expose event on the toplevel and convert to a draw signal
column8: which is propagated to *all* child widgets.\nSuggestion from gtk developers is to not ever look at expose events
column9: just ignore them and instead intercept the draw signal and that this should work for all GTK 3.x versions."

column7:
b"http://mail.openjdk.java.net/pipermail/jigsaw-dev/2017-May/012673.html
proposes a new default behavior that

a) would make the workarounds for bug 493761 and bug 516143 obsolete

b) could break Eclipse products on Java 9 if the current --permit-illegal-access gets removed and we still keep it in the default eclipse.ini (scenario from bug 493761 comment 61)

Currently
column8: we can't do much about that
column9: but I'm opening this bug as placeholder to keep it on the radar and follow the developments in Java 9.\n\nIf by RC3 (May 30) it looks like --permit-illegal-access is going to be removed
column10: then we should at least remove this argument from the eclipse.ini."

I understand this request is quite late in the release process

Many thanks.

column7:
b'There is two regression in the current WTP RC4 driver that are blocker for the discovery plugin and for external server adapters that use this function.

The two regression are caused by:
bug# 314823 - a fix coming from the platform
bug# 315065 - a missing character to the late update of one of the server adapters site'

b'Build Identifier: 3.0.5_patches

Within a product that adopts WTP we are experiencing a rather bad publishing performance problem.  This is a result of our product executing code generators as part of the publishers framework and our publisher destroying the entire WTP delta cache when those code generators complete.  We have to destroy the entire publishing cache because there is no finer-grained API to only destroy the modules that were affected by these code generators.

The attached patch will allow us to selectively destroy the cache so that we are not completely invalidating the entire cache.

Reproducible: Always'
b'Through a GitHub fork
column8:
I worked on the mavenization of the Java implementation of the MQTT client.

It allows to use the MQTT client library as a project dependency:
- in Eclipse by using the m2e plugin (http://www.eclipse.org/m2e/)
- in a standard Maven project or any build tool that is compatible with the Maven dependencies (Ivy
column9: Gradle
column10: sbt
column11: Grape
column12:
Buildr...)

The "package" Maven phase creates the Manifest file for OSGi bundle.

It also allows to launch unit tests easily
column13: and to execute continuous integration builds (using free platforms such as BuildHive
column14: https://buildhive.cloudbees.com/).\n\nPlease note
column15: that I added Nick and Dave as core developers (https://github.com/ndeverge/paho.mqtt.java/blob/mavenize/pom.xml)
column16: by refering to the People wiki page (http://wiki.eclipse.org/Paho/People).\n\nAnd if everyone is ok
column17:
I'll release a first version and publish the artefact in the newly created Eclipse Maven repository (http://wiki.eclipse.org/Maven).

git repo: git://github.com/ndeverge/paho.mqtt.java.git
branch: mavenize
full link:
https://github.com/ndeverge/paho.mqtt.java/commits/mavenize

I wrote all this code and have the rights to contribute it to Eclipse under the
eclipse.org web site terms of use.'

column7: b'LTW can be used in a development environment when the JVM is run under the debugger. If a class is modified it may be recompiled
column8: submitted to the JVM being debugged and "HotSwapped" (see bug 117854). The AspectJ 5 javaagent used for LTW is made aware of this through the JVMTI (http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/lang/instrument/ClassFileTransformer.html) but current implementation throws an exception. There may be a limited number of transformations we could safely perfrom especially if the aspects involved only implement dynamic cross-cutting.'

column7: b"We always support processing of old aspects.  It doesn't matter what level of AspectJ was used to build an aspect
column8: as long as you use that version or a later version of the weaver
column9: we can unpack it and don't require it to be rebuilt from source.  However
column10:
I've just encountered a .class apparently built with 1.5.4 that 1.6.1 cannot load.  It crashes deserializing a PointcutDeclaration.

In the data stream we have just read the numbers 1 and 3 indicating 'kinded pointcut' and then 'method-execution' and the next digit is a 0 when it should be 1-9.  We crash with a:

org.aspectj.weaver.BCException: weird kind 0
when batch building BuildConfig[null] #Files=43
 at org.aspectj.weaver.MemberKind.read(MemberKind.java:35)
 at org.aspectj.weaver.patterns.SignaturePattern.read(SignaturePattern.java:682)

The memberkind is a typesafeenum and so can never be other than 1-9.  It is the first part of a signaturepattern so hard to see how it got written out 'wrong' right now.

I've been told 1.5.4 can load this
column11: so about to try that. Wow....1.5.4 did load it back in
column12:
how the hell.

I suspect we aren't consuming enough in 1.6.1 which then leaves us some extra that we interpret as a rogue pointcut.

Ok
column13: in a comparison we consume one extra byte from the stream when reading it with 1.6.1 that we do not consume with 1.6.0 - at position 260.\n\nAs I got closer to it
column14: I knew what it would be - especially when I knew it was just one byte difference.  The version check for whether the byte for 'annotation pattern relates to a parameter match' was wrong (urgh)."

column7:
b"We are using Spring 3.0 and they have a dependency to aspectj. Thus we have the runtime Jars on the classpath.

Problem is the aspectjweaver.jar contains 1.6 byte code. When starting our application on JBoss 5.1 with JDK 1.5 we get an exception in the logs:

Unexpected error during load of:testdata.SomeAnnotation
java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Bad version number in .class file
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:620)
at org.jboss.classloader.spi.base.BaseClassLoader.access$200(BaseClassLoader.java:63)
at org.jboss.classloader.spi.base.BaseClassLoader$2.run(BaseClassLoader.java:572)
at org.jboss.classloader.spi.base.BaseClassLoader$2.run(BaseClassLoader.java:532)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)

As we are not using aspects from aspectj we don't have a problem ... but others might have. There is a issue for Spring as well:

https://issuetracker.springsource.com/browse/EBR-622

Also had a look at the current release 1.6.11 and the same situation there.

So as other people have no chance of working around this (other than building the jar themself) I set this to major."

column7: b"I see a lot of \\ in my localized Dutch Eclipse.  When translating through the webinterface
column8:
I notice strings like the following:

'=\' operator

I am pretty confident this cannot be correct.  I suppose it should be \'=\'.

An easy workaround for this would be to enter the 21st century and use proper curled unicode quotes instead
column9: so no more need for escaping: \xe2\x80\x98=\xe2\x80\x99"

column7: b"Many times Eclipse.org is being re-translated as Eclipse.org
column8: but it's not supposed to."

column7: b"Since we now record the plugin_id for properties file
column8:
some have blank values because they were deleted or are not anymore mapped to babel with a map file.

Two or three solutions:
1. Just don't generate for those files.
2. Remove them from the DB.
3. Flag those files as non existing during the processing and avoid generating for them."

column7: b"I am a committer of the Babel project
column8:
and we ship translations of Eclipse as fragments features.

As such we face a serious problem as some projects tend to add more plugins to Babel than what they actually ship.

In some cases fragments don't have a plugin host. Then people cannot update anymore.


I see 2 complementary solutions to this problem:
1. Don't bother too much with fragments. The old update manager was just ignoring them during updates. This new P2 behavior is felt like a regression by users right now.

2. Install fragments carefully: instead of taking the whole feature
column9: just take what you need."

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252790 +++\n\nProjects must have an project plan in XML format.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252791 +++\n\nProject representatives must attend the planning meetings and conference calls - you have to be involved to be involved.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252792 +++\n\nProjects must have a written ramp down policy by M6+0
column8: linked in the table above pending inclusion of ramp down element in the XML project plan. (One of the issues identified with this guideline is that its not so much the ramp down policy of how many votes are needed for each bug fix that we need to be consistent on
column9: but rather the meaning of each of the milestones and release candidates. See Platform 3.4 Endgame plan as a guideline. See also Galileo Final Daze.)'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252793 +++\n\nProjects must have their IP approved (a normal Eclipse requirement) and will follow the Eclipse Legal deadlines to do so. See also bug 220977.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252794 +++\n\nProjects should leverage only published APIs of dependencies. As a Release Review requirement
column8: deviations should be listed as part of a migration plan
column9: with bugs listed where APIs need to be provided by dependent projects.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252795 +++\n\nProjects must use Eclipse message bundles unless there are technical reasons not to. (see Message Bundle Conversion Tool and [1])'
b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252797 +++\n\nAll plug-ins (bundles) must use the true bundle form. That is
column8: provide a manifest.mf file
column9: and not rely on the plugin.xml file being 'translated' into a manifest.mf file at initial startup. See bug 130598. With that
column10: empty plugin.xml files in the presence of a manifest.mf file should not be included in a bundle."

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252798 +++\n\nAll plug-ins must correctly list their required JVM versions in the manifest.mf. See the wiki page about selecting the correct JVM.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252805 +++\n\nMust have new & noteworthy for each milestone. Must be something readable and usable not just a static list of all the bugs
column8: e.g. platform. Corollary: individual new & noteworthy should be linked in to the collective New & Noteworthy.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252806 +++\n\nThis means that users can load any subset of the Galileo projects into Eclipse and each of the loaded projects will pass all the same tests as if it had been loaded independently. If such a problem is identified
column8: the affected projects must fix the problem.'

b'Please provide information (by April 22) as to any known fix or workaround to 
the following problem. Let me know ASAP if further debugging information is 
required.

Internal bug report reads:

Bug in Eclipse shell is causing ProductXXX help to randomly display blank 
topics. To reproduce
column8: click on the "ProductXXX User Guide" TOC tab and start \nclicking topics. Some topics will show up blank. This is completely random. If \nyou then delete the help metadata
column9: and restart ProductXXX
column10: a different set of \ntopics display blank. Some topics also display blank from the Search tab
column11:
also
randomly.

We have narrowed it down to an Eclipse bug that relates to compatibility with 
certain JRE's. The JRE we used during beta
column13: did not have the \nproblem. We have switched to build 1.3.1_02-b02
column14: and this does have the \nproblem. We downloaded build 1.3.1_03
column15: and in limited experimentation
column16: this \nseems worse than 1.3.1_02. Finally
column17: 1.4.0 is OK. Unfortunately
column18: it is too late\nin our process to switch to 1.4. We also cannot go back to our beta version \nbecause it had other problems.'

column7:
b'Please provide information (by April 22) regarding known fix or workaround for 
the following problem.

----------------------------------------------
Internal bug report reads:

If you shut down ProductXXX with the Help perspective as the active
perspective showing the ProductXXX help
column8:
the next time you open ProductXXX it 
immediately crashes.

To reproduce:
- Open ProductXXX.
- Open the ProductXXX Help
column9:
either User Guide or API Reference. 
- Click on any topic in the TOC.
- Close ProductXXX (without changing back to another perspective). 
- Open ProductXXX again. It will crash immediately. 

This is extremely serious
column10: since it will continue to happen unless you delete \nthe Help metadata (.metadata\\.plugins.\\org.eclipse.help.ui). We have found that \nif you delete the Help metadata before trying to restart ProductXXX
column11:
it will 
then open successfully. This is further evidence that it is opening ProductXXX 
in the Help perspective that causes it to crash.

Eclipse generates a 0-length log file 
(.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.help.ui.log) when the crash
happens. It would be REALLY useful if Eclipse could generate a log file with 
data in it. 

We have verified this on multiple machines. It does seem related to the JRE 
problem - we believe we have only seen this with jre 1.3.1.* - this is NOT a 
certainty
column12: just a suspicion. Also
column13: it appears to be more likely to occur if the \nselected page in the help perspective is one of the pages that would come up \nblank.'

column7: b'Hi
column8:
I have been successfully running Eclipse (20020416) in Information Center mode 
for the last few weeks on my Web server.  When I upgraded to the latest 2.0 
stable build (F1 - 20020521)
column9: my Information Center would not work
column10:
and 
standalone help also stopped working.

I followed the updated installation instructions at:

http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/~checkout~/platform-help-
home/infocenter.html

When I try to access my new F1 Eclipse help system 
(http://netquestion.hursley.ibm.com:8080/help) the following error is displayed 
in my IE window:

There was an error in your action: 
javax.servlet.ServletException: org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader 

I am running Tomcat 3.2 and have modified the server.xml file in the conf 
directory of Tomcat to point to the correct plugin directory.

Here's what the context entry in my server.xml file looks like:

 <Context path="/help" 
   docBase="D:\eclipsef1\plugins\org.eclipse.help.webapp_2.0.0" >
 </Context>

Do you have any ideas as to why my information center
column11:
and standalone help has 
stopped working as a result of upgrading to F1?

Why are version numbers included in the directory names?  This is messy and I'm 
sure has caused the problems I am experiencing.  The version number is 
generally stored in plugin.xml.  Why does it need to be in two places?

Many thanks
column12:
Steve

WebSphere MQ Information Architect
IBM United Kingdom Laboratories
Hursley Park
Winchester
UK'

column7: b'I just updated to Eclipse 3.0 M6 and was trying to figure out how to download\nnew features. The help page for installing new features appears to still be for\nv2.1 because it is still making references to the update manager.'
b"Jeff
column8: Pascal and I have discussed this quite a bit
column9: but never opened a bug for \nit. So here it is: update should not attempt to uninstall the automatically \nstarted bundles (osgi
column10: runtime
column11: configurator) because it did not install them \nitself. These bundles appear on the osig.bundles property.\nMore generally
column12:
update should not uninstall any bundles that it did not 
install (this could include bundles that have been installed by other 
configurators).

An example of this problem can be seen when updating eclipse itself (Ed's 
posting on the mailing list):

column7: b"As per dorian birsan
column8: I am entering this bug. I have tried on several occasions\nand several ways to update my Eclipse version 3.0.0 to 3.0.1. In every case the\noutcome was the same
column9: Eclipse will not run. I can make it run by deleting the\nconfiguration directory
column10:
but then it thinks it is still in version 3.0.0 and
continues to ask me if I want to update. I also end up with both the 3.0.0 and
the 3.0.1 versions of the files being loaded and who knows what kind of problems
that will create.

I have entered a bug on the buildId not updating as a Runtime bug as per dorian
birsan. The bug # is 74621.

The update process takes 4-5 hours to download the files
column11: there are one or more\nfiles that are 'unsigned'
column12: the update processes fails many times with a dialog\nto 'retry' and on one occasion it failed so bad I had to back up and start\nagain. Needless to say
column13: with the overly long download times
column14:
I can only make one
update attempt per day. And I have done this 4 times.

I have even gone so far as to unzip 3.0.0 into C:\Eclipse which created the
eclipse directory. Started Eclipse and went immediately to Help -> Software
Updates -> Manage Configuration
column15: clicked on Scan for Updates and followed\nthe instructions to start the download. 4.5 hours later
column16: after 8 retries\nand 1 complete restart
column17:
I get the 'Restart the Workbench' dialog box. Was
I successful?

No. Same problem as before. The config.ini still has the original build Id
in it and it still won't open.

column7: b"Build: I-20041109-1436\n\nWhen you start Eclipse
column8:
you get several instances of the error pasted below in 
the log in your host instance. 

At first
column9: I did not even notice it
column10: as things appeared normal.  Then I \nlaunched a runtime app and noticed that none of the plugins in my workspace \nare getting picked up.  I then looked at the log of the runtime app
column11: and I saw \nsimilar parse errors spit out by Update.  I looked at the platform.xml that \nPDE generates for update
column12: and I saw a default one (i.e. one with just \nfeatures)
column13:
which means that Update choked on the platform.xml PDE generated 
using Update's API.

This makes the build unusable as self-hosting is impossible.

column7: b'I left I20050215-2300 running overnight. When I came in this morning it said new\nupdates were available
column8: would I like to install them? I said yes
column9: and it opened\nthe Search Results window. However that window does not list any updates. It\nsays No updates for the currently installed features(s)found
column10: try again later.\n(sic: note no blank between \')\' and found). The option to Show the latest\nversion of a feature only is checked
column11:
and the option to Filter patches included
in other patches is unchecked. However changing those options does not have any
effect. All the buttons were grayed out except Deselect All (which was wierd
because there was nothing to deselect) and Cancel. 

When I clicked Cancel it gave me the Automatic Updates dialog again. "New
updates are available and downloaded. Do you want to review and install them
now?". I selected Yes again
column12: got the empty Search Results dialog again. Cancel
column13: \nrepeat. So the next time I said No. I got the first "New updates are\navailable..." dialog again
column14: yes/no. Either way leads to infinite repetition. I\'m\nunable to use Eclipse or even see the Workbench window currently. :-('

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252789 +++\n\nAt least one person from each project must subscribe to cross-project bug inbox
column8: i.e. edit Bugzilla prefs to watch "cross-project.inbox@eclipse.org". Build team members (or their designated alternates) from each project will provide communication channels: phone
column9: mail
column10: IM
column11: IRC and will be available during the milestone integration periods.'

column7: b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252800 +++\n\nProjects must use jar'ed plug-ins (with unpack=false) unless authorized by the planning council for technical reasons. Nested jars should be avoided if possible since it creates problems for projects that has dependencies to such plug-ins. The OSGi runtime is fine with it but the compiler is not able to handle classpaths that contain nested jars. In case only one nested jar exists
column8: it is often better to expand the contents of that jar into the root folder (i.e. unnest the jar). If a plug-in contains large files that are frequently used (opened and closed)
column9: a jar'ed plug-in might degrade performance significantly since the file must be decompressed each time it is opened."

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252806 +++\n\nThis means that users can load any subset of the Galileo projects into Eclipse and each of the loaded projects will pass all the same tests as if it had been loaded independently. If such a problem is identified
column8: the affected projects must fix the problem.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252808 +++\n\nThe project participates in Babel
column8: meaning it is registered and available for string translation
column9: etc.'

column7: b'This would provide an automatic notification to teams of build success/failure.  If failure
column8: it should indicate the teams that need to resubmit.  Also
column9: this message should provide a link to the build page.\n\nThis would eliminate the need to for someone to send out status each time a Europa build runs.'

b'birt-runtime.zip example needs some additional jars

For the chart API to work we need to copy the following jars
org.eclipse.birt.chart.engine_2.1.0.jar (we need to rename it to chartengineapi.jar)
org.eclipse.emf.common_2.2.0.jar
org.eclipse.emf.ecore.xml_2.2.0.jar
org.eclipse.emf.ecore_2.2.0.jar

Copy the above jars to following locations.
1) WebViewerExample/Web-Inf/lib

2) ReportEngine/lib

in birtruntime.zip archive.'

b"In case if the birt framework installed as separate package(birt-report-framework-N20060602) report perspective in eclipse doesn't work.

See the following error message:

Problems occurred restoring perspective.
  Could not find view: org.eclipse.gef.ui.palette_view
  Could not find view: org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.views.data.DataView
  Could not find view: org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.lib.explorer.view
  Could not find view: org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui.attributes.AttributeView

How many times other people and I have to report this issue?
It seems nobody bother at least once to test installation of eclipse when the birt installed separately from eclipse."

b'There are two problems with the org.eclipse.birt.sdk_2.1.0.N20060609-1710 feature.

1. The feature.xml for org.eclipse.birt.sdk_2.1.0.N20060609-1710 has this includes tag 
     <includes
         id="org.apache.xerces"
         version="2.8.0.N20060609-1710"/>
However
column8:
the feature id for org.apache.xerces_2.8.0.N20060609-1710 is "org.apache.xerces.feature". This is causing some eclipse update tools to fail and can be rectified by changing the includes tag to 
     <includes
         id="org.apache.xerces.feature"
         version="2.8.0.N20060609-1710"/>

2. Feature.xml for this feature includes <includes
         id="org.apache.batik.pdf"
         version="1.6.0.N20060609-1710"/> and this version of the feature is not packaged with the birt sdk zip.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252789 +++\n\nAt least one person from each project must subscribe to cross-project bug inbox
column8: i.e. edit Bugzilla prefs to watch "cross-project.inbox@eclipse.org". Build team members (or their designated alternates) from each project will provide communication channels: phone
column9: mail

column11: IRC and will be available during the milestone integration periods.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252796 +++\n\nProjects must use 4-part version numbers.'

b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252799 +++\n\nProjects must use signed plugins using the Eclipse certificate. Exceptions must be authorized by the planning council for technical reasons.'

b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252800 +++\n\nProjects must use jar'ed plug-ins (with unpack=false) unless authorized by the planning council for technical reasons. Nested jars should be avoided if possible since it creates problems for projects that has dependencies to such plug-ins. The OSGi runtime is fine with it but the compiler is not able to handle classpaths that contain nested jars. In case only one nested jar exists
column8: it is often better to expand the contents of that jar into the root folder (i.e. unnest the jar). If a plug-in contains large files that are frequently used (opened and closed)
column9: a jar'ed plug-in might degrade performance significantly since the file must be decompressed each time it is opened."

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252801 +++\n\nProjects must have build process maturity: scripted
column8: repeatable
column9: and executable by others.'

column7: b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252803 +++\n\nAny new third-party plug-ins that are common between projects must be consumed via Orbit; the final Galileo release will not have duplicate third-party libraries (note that this only applies to identical versions of the libraries; thus if project A requires foo.jar 1.6 and project B uses foo.jar 1.7
column8: that's ok)."

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252804 +++\n\nProjects must optimize their own update site using pack200 to reduce bandwidth utilization and provide a better update experience for users. With the introduction of p2
column8: project update sites must generate metadata (artifact and content repository info).'

column8:
so i have add the dump params on outofmemory:

2013-01-29 08:22:07 - Starting java -Xrs -Xmx768m -XX:MaxPermSize=128M -XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError -XX:HeapDumpPath=D:\temp\hudson_dumps -Dhudson.lifecycle=hudson.lifecycle.WindowsServiceLifecycle -jar "d:\hudson\hudson.war" --httpPort=8080 --ajp13Port=-1


i have analyized the dump
column9: it seems all the memory is wasted in the class org.hudsonci.xpath.impl.Dom2Dom
column10: field weakhashmap named "cache". It seems this WeakHashMap dont\' do what it have to do
column11: it prevents the objects from being GCed... May be hudson keeps somewhere strong references to the KEYS
column12: which would prevent WeakHashMap from freeing the Values stored in the weakhashmap for GC?\n\nThe memory dump is very big(~1gb) so i dont really want to upload it. Please let me know if you need more information.'

column7: b"That goes for copy-job and update-job (create) as well.\n\nA user submitted a config.xml file that was garbage. It had quotes around the entire file and the character sequence '\\r\\n' between each line (not CR LF
column8: but those 4 characters). Job creation failed with a 500. Nonetheless
column9:
the job was created with the bad config.xml and Hudson later threw an NPE trying to load it. This happened during the updating of the dependency graph.

Note that suppressing the NPE does not fix the problem of creating a broken job.

column7: b"Eclipse 3.2 M4\n\nIf you try to start a workbench with no Mylar views visible the MylarUuPlugin fails to activate.  The activation attempt is coming from the lightweight decorator.  This activation attempt is being run in a non UI thread which is causing the creation of the ColorMap instance variable to fail as it requires TaskListImages which creates an image registry which assumes it is being run in a UI thread.  The color map is used in initializeHighlighters
column8: so the map can't just be lazily created.\n\nI have only noticed this with 3.2
column9: so perhaps it is a JFace regression?  Still
column10: the plugin shouldn't make assumptions about the thread it is running on.\n\nMoving the creation of the ColorMap into the constructor and wrapping it in a syncExec call does work
column11:
but locks up the UI for a good 10-20 seconds.

column7:
b'Created attachment 212579 [details]
Strip out the %trimmedwindow.label.eclipseSDK

Version: 4.2.0
Build id: I20120313-0610

The initial window for RCP apps shows a title of "%trimmedwindow.label.eclipseSDK".  The cause is a mismatch between the translated string key in the code and the plugin.properties file
column8: which uses "trimmedwindow.label.1"
column9: done in bug 351033.\n\nBut as I pointed out in bug 372523
column10: RCP apps don\'t want a string showing "Eclipse SDK 4.0" on startup anyways.\n\nAttached patch strips out the window label and the now-useless key from the translation file.'

column7: b'This might be a problem for the JDT gang
column8:
but it seems to only be appearing in
the GTK version.

Open up a java workspace
column9: and select a method (click once). \nLeft click to bring up the context menu
column10:
go down to "References" and search in
the workspace or hierarchy or whatever.

If you have just opened the workspace
column11:
the program will beep.  I guess
signalling  nothing found.  

If you double click on the method instead (not quite sure the difference
column12:
though
I think double clicking causes the method's name to be selected in the editor
pane).  Then try finding the references again. It will find them.

The real problem is after a reference has been found-- you usually click twice
on it to bring it up in the editor to look at.  Then if you go over to the
overview pane again and either (a) click once to select and then right click on
a method or (b) just right click on a method
column13: you will instead find that when\nyou search for references again
column14: you will bring up the references that is\nhighlighted in the editor. Quite confusing!'

b"I tried to get the SML validator editor from the download page and I have a few issues with the way the package is offered now.
I am raising this issue to critical since I see this as a major inhibitor for anybody trying to use the SML validation code.

Issue number one :

The package offered on the build page does not contain all dependencies. The main reason this type of packaging is offered on the download page is to allow SML users to make use of the validator without having to download all COSMOS.

The package doesn't include everything though. As I am warned by the comment attached to the download that I am missing one more plugin. Which I can take if I download the entire data collection component.. That defeats the purpose of having a separate download for the SML. It would actually be much easier to just download everything at once ( one click ) then going through this two step process.

This is the note that I mention : Note: in order to run the Resource Modeling tools on their own
column8:
you will also need to install the org.eclipse.cosmos.dc.cmdbf.query plug-in found in the Data Collection Framework download file

Second issue :

The note is incorrect. Looking at the plugin dependency structure
column9:
it seems that I don't need org.eclipse.cosmos.dc.cmdbf.query but org.eclipse.cosmos.dc.cmdbf.services plugin. 

What needs to be fixed here :
option 1 ( preferred ) : get rid of the Note above and include in the SML package the org.eclipse.cosmos.dc.cmdbf.services plugin. Since we are not Update Manager ready anyway I would not worry now what feature this plugin is part of.
option 2 : fix the Note and make the plugin available separately from the Data Collection component ( which gets to option 1.. )"

column7: b'Due to some dependencies introduced by the SML MDR implementation (my assumption that this is what leaded to the dependency)
column8: the SMLIF editor plugin now depends on the Data Collection CMDBf implementation
column9: dc.cmdbf.services plugin\n\nAside of the fact that this dependencies requires SMLIF editor end users to download the entire Data Collection component
column10: there is no logical reason for having the SMLIF editor implementation depend on CMDBf.\nThe SML MDR support is required but should be added as an extension to the existing SMLIF editor functionality and not as a new dependency. We should try to separate the SML MDR implementation from the IF editor.'

column7:
b'Overview: When new sites are created only the policy USER-EXCLUDE is used. There should be a choice.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start Eclipse 3.2M5 sdk.
2. Shutdown Eclipse
3. Change the platform.xml from
<site enabled="true" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="platform:/base/">
to 
<site enabled="true" policy="MANAGED-ONLY" updateable="true" url="platform:/base/">
4. Restart eclipse
5. You will see some jdt errors if you have the console open. These are not related to this bug.
6. Help->Software Updates->Find and install
7. Search for new features to install
8. Add a new local site to sites to search. I used the xyz sample site created by cheatsheet.
9. Finish
10. Select xyz feature to install
11.On the install page of wizard select "Change Location" button.
12. On the New Update Site Dialog choose "Add Location"
13. Browse to a new site to be added.
14. OK. Finish install.
15. After eclipse has restarted
column8:
check the platform.xml the new site will be using USER-EXCLUDE
<site enabled="true" policy="USER-EXCLUDE" updateable="true" url="file:../../../ctemp/eclipse/">
<feature id="com.example.xyz" url="features/com.example.xyz_2.0.0/" version="2.0.0">
</feature>
</site>

EXPECTED RESULTS: Since I am using the policy MANAGED-ONLY I would expect that any new sites created would be using this policy.

I have provided a patch with this bug. Since for MANAGED-ONLY we are always providing a platform.xml the change in policy does not need to happen until after the platform.xml is parsed. However this patch makes an assumption. The DTD allows each site to specify its own policy. My assumption is that if we are using MANAGED-ONLY we will want all sites to be that policy. So to set the default policy only the first site is checked for its policy. If the policy is MANAGED-ONLY for this site the default policy is set to MANAGED-ONLY.

If this is not satisfactory I can provide a different patch that reads the default policy from a preference.'

b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #251715 +++\n\nProjects must have stated and demonstrated their intent to join Galileo by the M4+0 date.  Projects do so by adding themselves to this bug and each of the P1 bugs used to define "Must-Do" requirements for train participation.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252790 +++\n\nProjects must have an project plan in XML format.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252791 +++\n\nProject representatives must attend the planning meetings and conference calls - you have to be involved to be involved.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252792 +++\n\nProjects must have a written ramp down policy by M6+0
column8: linked in the table above pending inclusion of ramp down element in the XML project plan. (One of the issues identified with this guideline is that its not so much the ramp down policy of how many votes are needed for each bug fix that we need to be consistent on
column9: but rather the meaning of each of the milestones and release candidates. See Platform 3.4 Endgame plan as a guideline. See also Galileo Final Daze.)'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252794 +++\n\nProjects should leverage only published APIs of dependencies. As a Release Review requirement
column8: deviations should be listed as part of a migration plan
column9: with bugs listed where APIs need to be provided by dependent projects.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252795 +++\n\nProjects must use Eclipse message bundles unless there are technical reasons not to. (see Message Bundle Conversion Tool and [1])'

b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252800 +++\n\nProjects must use jar'ed plug-ins (with unpack=false) unless authorized by the planning council for technical reasons. Nested jars should be avoided if possible since it creates problems for projects that has dependencies to such plug-ins. The OSGi runtime is fine with it but the compiler is not able to handle classpaths that contain nested jars. In case only one nested jar exists
column8: it is often better to expand the contents of that jar into the root folder (i.e. unnest the jar). If a plug-in contains large files that are frequently used (opened and closed)
column9: a jar'ed plug-in might degrade performance significantly since the file must be decompressed each time it is opened."

column7: b'In implementing a proof of concept tag drop implementation
column8: I discovered that we are not passing enough context information for the tag drop to cover all use cases.  The change adds a new runCustomizer to IDropCustomizer that passes File and DOMPosition information about the intended drop and deprecates the existing no argument version.  The AbstractDropCustomizer will call runCustomizer() from the new method by default
column9: ensuring backward compatibility of both interface and behaviour.  No-arg runCustomizer is now deprecated
column10: however.'

b'We changed the way that the taglib resolver is constructed so that it returns a ViewBasedTaglibResolver instead of the old DefaultTaglibResolver.  As a result of this
column8: we unintentionally tied resolver construction to the lifecycle of the JSF core plugin and the JSF facet.  \n\nWe have just discovered that this causes some critical loss of service in our OEPE adopter product.  We need to change the way these factories are selected so that we can guarantee that they are loaded and executed in a certain order.'

column7: b'When a file is copied into the same folder from the Navigator
column8:
the 
translated "Copy of" string is appended to the end of file name. This causes 
the file extension to be changed.

STEPS: 
- Create a java file called "abc.java".
- Select the file in the Navigator.
- Select Copy from the pop-up menu
- Copy it to the same folder.

Result:
- The new file name is "abc.java \uxxxx..." where "\uxxxx..." is the translated 
string.

Problem: The file extension is no longer .java. It's not treated as a java 
element.

Additional info:
The externalized strings in the message files with the keys "copyNameOneArg" 
and "copyNameTwoArgs" for the actions CopyResourceAction and CopyProjectAction 
need to be reworded for the following files:
   - messages_ja.properties
   - messages_ko.properties
   - messages_zh_cn.properties
   - messages_zh_tw.properties'

column9: the contents of that feature have been different in each declare.  This is causing problems for adopter products that are picking up these declares- since the qualifier is an exact match

b'The Classpath Dependency Validator is not working in WTP 3.2.  This validator is crucial for notification of items placed on the Java Build Path that will not be deployed properly to a server
column8: thus potentially causing runtime exceptions on the server.\n\nThe reason why this is broken is the change made in bug 298905 - the facet id was changed from jst.java to java
column9: but the Classpath Dependency Validator still enables only for the (now non-existent) jst.java facet.'

we should refresh all of them.

column7: b'Build Identifier: 3.0.5 P\n\nThis bug is related to bug 322173.  In bug 322173
column8: a new method has been added to find out the affected project.  However
column9:
there is currently no way for the adopter to figure out if all the deployer has implemented the new method. This will make the adopter not be able to decide whether to use the information on the new methods or not.  This information is essential to support properly the case where some deployer has not provided the affect project information to avoid regression on those scenarios.

This bug is to address this issue by introducing a new method to tell the adoptor on whether all deployers has provided the affected project information.

Reproducible: Always'

b'This fix needs to get into the active development streams - R3_2_maintenance and HEAD.

+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #343558 +++

Currently
column8: if JEM is gathering (or has gathered) the Methods from a (JEM) JavaClass
column9: and a flush() occurs
column10: the Methods are removed from their parents and are invalid
column11: resulting in NPEs and other errors without any warning.\n\nThere are things we can do
column12: such as replacing the parent JavaClass with a JavaClassRef
column13: that will at least keep the current Methods useful
column14: while still allowing the flush to proceed.'

column7: b'As can be shown by bug 363863

column10: JCAs

column7: b'Opening this bug as a result of the discussion on bug 379273.  We need a way to reliably build the JPA Diagram Editor.  This will require a solution to the problem that requires us to create a zip distro for Graphiti.  Carl seemed to think the key to the issue of not being able to use a p2 based build could be in the following text copied from my comment in bug 379273.\n\n"OK...so with a little more research
column8: it appears that the only dependency on EMF Validation is coming from o.e.emf.transaction
column9: which specifically depends on o.e.emf.validation bundle.  There does not appear to be any need for o.e.emf.validation.ui or o.e.emf.validation.ocl in our build.  It would be nice if we could leave out emf.validation.ui and emf.validation.ocl from the build
column10: as these don\'t appear to be required by anything and at the very least are causing build messages that could be avoided.  So I think the OCL issue is a red herring."\n\nPlease see the other bug comments for additional context.'

column7: b"Graphiti made (announced) breaking API changes in their M6 contribution.  Dali didn't commit changes to support the API changes until 3-18
column8: and it was too late to update our Graphiti prereq at that time.  I actually didn't realize the severity of the issue until 3-19 when I pulled the commit.  I think part of this was a miscommunication between Petya and myself. I suspect that the Diagram Editor M6 will fail at runtime if it is used with Kepler M6 aggregation as a result of this. \n\nSince then
column9: the Diagram Editor changes were released
column10: and this has broken the post M6 builds.\n\nI'm going to roll back our map files to the M6 tag to resolve the build issue for now
column11: but we need to get Graphiti prereq updated before we can release again."

column7: b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #408159 +++\n\nThe Java EE 7 schemas in GF 4.0 b89 from today (last planned release candidate) contain some changes from the revision of schemas currently integrated into WTP. The schemas

column10:
comment #5:

1. Documentation improvements.

column12: interceptorType has new around-construct child element.\n\n4. In javaee_7.xsd
column13: the class-name element within connection-factory-resourceType has been renamed as interface-name.\n\n5. In javaee_7.xsd
column14: jms-connection-factoryType has new interface-name child element.\n\n6. In javaee_7.xsd
column15: jms-destinationType has new interface-name child element.\n\n7. Some type definitions moved around between web-app_3_1.xsd
column16: web-common_3_1.xsd and web-fragment_3_1.xsd. It isn't immediately clear if other changes are hidden within those movements.\n\n8. In web-facelettaglibrary_2_2.xsd
column17: facelet-taglibType has new short-name child element."

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #305066 +++\n\nIn the model regeneration for Java EE 6 (now
column9: the default for the new <enabled> attribute for servlets is false.  That means that any servlet created will not be available on the server - see section 8.2.2 of the Servlet 3.0 specification.  That is bad - we need the default to be enabled

b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #426884 +++

I have a problem with my maven webapp and jdk 1.8.
I have installed jdk 1.8
column8:
the JDT/Eclipse Java 8 Support (BETA) and Eclipse Maven Support (http://download.eclipse.org/technology/m2e/milestones/1.5)
After I changed the java version of my webapp to jdk 1.8 I got following error message when try to update my maven project.
"Could not update project webapp configuration
 Version 1.8 of project facet java does not exist"
Attached a screenshot.
Best regards
D.C
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
Explain why you believe this is a stop-ship defect:
* It's impossible to create a Java EE project (with or without Maven) using the new Java 8 support released for Kepler SR2. 

Is there a work-around? If so
column9:
why do you believe the work-around is insufficient?
* There is no workaround.

How has the fix been tested? Is there a test case attached to the bugzilla record? Has a JUnit Test been added?
* A patch exists for the Luna stream (see bug #426884)
column10:
but no unit tests are attached.

Give a brief technical overview. Who has reviewed this fix?
* The fix adds proper Java 8 Facet support when Java 8 is detected. The patch was created by Konstantin Komissarchik

What is the risk associated with this fix?
* Low. The patch is fairly straightforward


So we (Red Hat)
column11: would like to see this patch applied as a feature patch for Kepler SR2
column12: along the Java 8 support patch that was released today.'

column7: b'In the latest org.eclipse.core.runtime builds
column8: ListenerList uses the Java 8 class java.util.stream.Stream.  Since DependencyGraphImpl extends that class
column9: it needs access to that API
column10: so it must move up to Java 8.'

column7: b'In the latest org.eclipse.core.runtime builds
column8: ListenerList uses the Java 8 class java.util.stream.Stream.  Since J2EEComponentClasspathUpdater extends that class
column9: it needs access to that API
column10: so it must move up to Java 8.'

b"We have some code that creates a project and then installs a custom facet.  We're seeing a deadlock with the DependencyGraphImpl's GraphUpdateJob.

Our code creates the project and then uses FacetedProject#modify() to install our own facet in the project.  It hangs attempting to acquire the project's lock.  But it has already acquired the ComponentImplManager's synchronization lock (stack frame marked with XXX):

Thread [ModalContext] (Suspended (entry into method getProjectLockObject in EMFWorkbenchEditContextFactory))

column42:
IProgressMonitor) line: 2267 
 CreateAppEngineStandardWtpProject(WorkspaceModifyOperation).run(IProgressMonitor) line: 128 
 ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run() line: 119 


The project creation spawns a GraphUpdateJob that call ComponentImplManager#createComponent(IProject).  This method first acquires the associated project lock
column45:
which is a synchronized method.

Thread [Worker-0] (Suspended (entry into method getProjectLockObject in EMFWorkbenchEditContextFactory)) 
 EMFWorkbenchEditContextFactory.getProjectLockObject(IProject) line: 63 
 ComponentImplManager.createComponent(IProject) line: 207 
 ComponentCore.createComponent(IProject) line: 64 
 DependencyGraphImpl$GraphUpdateJob$1.run() line: 494 
 SafeRunner.run(ISafeRunnable) line: 42

 Worker.run() line: 56 

If the GraphUpdateJob acquires the project lock first
column46: we have deadlock as our ModalContext thread has the ComponentImplManager's synchronization lock."

column7:
b'For some scenarios i would like to set the visibility (hide/show) for table 
columns or rows.

Note
column8: for a column to hide I don\'t simply want the content of the column \nhidden.  I do not want the column to be rendered at all. ie. if the column is \nhidden
column9: then there should be one less "td" block per row of the table.'

column7:
b'With the latest 30 April build
- Add a cross tab report item
- No drag a data item from a dataset.

Expected result - Simple cube builder should be shown
Current behavior - An exception is thrown

Exception details
---------------------
An unexpected internal exception occurred.Please see log for detail.
  Plug-in Provider:Eclipse.org
  Plug-in Name:BIRT Designer UI
  Plug-in ID:org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui
  Version:2.2.0.v20070430-0630
  Error Code:Error.GUIException.invokedByUnexpectedException
  Error Message:Caused by java.lang.NullPointerException.'

b"Steps to reproduct the issue
---------------------------
- Open the attached report design
- Open the cube builder
- Add a new measure to the cube from the primary dataset
- Click 'ok' button in the cube builder


Expected behavior 
- I should be able to proceed with 'ok' and the dialog should close

Current behavior
- Show the prompt 'Link the data field of primary dataset to other data sets in order to build a cube'. This prompt should not be shown."
b'To promote maintainability of the Eclipse-RPM core
column8: I suggest that we do a bit\nof refactoring in org.eclipse.cdt.rpm.core for the 3.0 release.  I will attach a\nbrief UML diagram that outlines my proposal.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252789 +++\n\nAt least one person from each project must subscribe to cross-project bug inbox
column8: i.e. edit Bugzilla prefs to watch "cross-project.inbox@eclipse.org". Build team members (or their designated alternates) from each project will provide communication channels: phone
column9: mail
column10: IM
column11: IRC and will be available during the milestone integration periods.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252790 +++\n\nProjects must have an project plan in XML format.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252791 +++\n\nProject representatives must attend the planning meetings and conference calls - you have to be involved to be involved.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252792 +++\n\nProjects must have a written ramp down policy by M6+0
column8: linked in the table above pending inclusion of ramp down element in the XML project plan. (One of the issues identified with this guideline is that its not so much the ramp down policy of how many votes are needed for each bug fix that we need to be consistent on
column9: but rather the meaning of each of the milestones and release candidates. See Platform 3.4 Endgame plan as a guideline. See also Galileo Final Daze.)'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252793 +++\n\nProjects must have their IP approved (a normal Eclipse requirement) and will follow the Eclipse Legal deadlines to do so. See also bug 220977.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252794 +++\n\nProjects should leverage only published APIs of dependencies. As a Release Review requirement
column8: deviations should be listed as part of a migration plan
column9: with bugs listed where APIs need to be provided by dependent projects.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252795 +++\n\nProjects must use Eclipse message bundles unless there are technical reasons not to. (see Message Bundle Conversion Tool and [1])'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252796 +++\n\nProjects must use 4-part version numbers.'
b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252797 +++\n\nAll plug-ins (bundles) must use the true bundle form. That is
column8: provide a manifest.mf file
column9: and not rely on the plugin.xml file being 'translated' into a manifest.mf file at initial startup. See bug 130598. With that
column10: empty plugin.xml files in the presence of a manifest.mf file should not be included in a bundle."

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252798 +++\n\nAll plug-ins must correctly list their required JVM versions in the manifest.mf. See the wiki page about selecting the correct JVM.'

b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252799 +++\n\nProjects must use signed plugins using the Eclipse certificate. Exceptions must be authorized by the planning council for technical reasons.'

b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252800 +++\n\nProjects must use jar'ed plug-ins (with unpack=false) unless authorized by the planning council for technical reasons. Nested jars should be avoided if possible since it creates problems for projects that has dependencies to such plug-ins. The OSGi runtime is fine with it but the compiler is not able to handle classpaths that contain nested jars. In case only one nested jar exists
column8: it is often better to expand the contents of that jar into the root folder (i.e. unnest the jar). If a plug-in contains large files that are frequently used (opened and closed)
column9: a jar'ed plug-in might degrade performance significantly since the file must be decompressed each time it is opened."

column7: b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252803 +++\n\nAny new third-party plug-ins that are common between projects must be consumed via Orbit; the final Galileo release will not have duplicate third-party libraries (note that this only applies to identical versions of the libraries; thus if project A requires foo.jar 1.6 and project B uses foo.jar 1.7
column8: that's ok)."

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252804 +++\n\nProjects must optimize their own update site using pack200 to reduce bandwidth utilization and provide a better update experience for users. With the introduction of p2
column8: project update sites must generate metadata (artifact and content repository info).'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252805 +++\n\nMust have new & noteworthy for each milestone. Must be something readable and usable not just a static list of all the bugs
column8: e.g. platform. Corollary: individual new & noteworthy should be linked in to the collective New & Noteworthy.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252807 +++\n\nEach project will provide basic capability/activity definitions to allow for their UI contributions to be hidden. These must be provided in a separate plugin/feature to facilitate inclusion/exclusion by consumers in product development.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252808 +++\n\nThe project participates in Babel
column8: meaning it is registered and available for string translation
column9: etc.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252809 +++\n\nMust use  ICU4J.'
b'The current backbone needs some refactor: \n--> It should be independent from UML2\n--> It should not use the Papyrus DI from Papyrus (first version)'
b'When you select several elements in model explorer and you try to drag and drop it
column8: only the last one is restored.'

column7: b'Switching the active diagram to another cause the isDirty flag on the editor
column8: whereas no changes has been made in the model or in the diagram.\n\nThis may have something to do with the information stored in the .di file
column9: which content the sash model state. It may be better to store this kind of information as local
column10: and avoid storing information like which diagram is opened
column11: active
column12: or the sash state. The isDirty flag should be set only when model or diagram content is modified
column13: not when the user modifies his own windows (diagrams) organization.'

column7: b"Some plugins are not directly part of the Papyrus distribution. They can be moved in another hierarchy.\nThis will ease the creation of a main feature (Papyrus)
column8:
and additional features linked to the extra plugins.
Example of plugins:
- java reverse
- modisco adapter
- example.*
- umltools adapters
- ...
I propose to create a new dir called 'extraplugins' at the same level as the 'plugins' dir.
In this 'extraplugins' dir
column9:
we will have one dir for each possible extra feature.

Example of the proposal:
  --trunk 
       +--- plugins
       +--- extraplugins
                  +--- reverse
                            +--- org.eclipse.papyrus.java.reverse
                            +--- org.eclipse.papyrus.java.reverse.ui
                  +--- modisco
                            +--- org.eclipse.papyrus.adaptor.modisco
                  +--- sashexamples
                           +--- org.eclipse.papyrus.example...."

b'20020519 Win32

I have created a dummy subdirectory in the features/ directory that contained 
no feature.xml. At the same time I "touched" (made a dummy edit and saved) a 
real feature.xml in another feature subdirectory (to trigger change detection).

On startup
column8:
reconciler processed the dummy subdirectory as a change (even 
though it has no feature.xml) and produces a delta. This triggered the "you've 
got changes" dialog showing <path>/features/<dummy dir>/(0.0.0) as the change.

If a feature directory does not contain feature.xml IT IS NOT A FEATURE and 
should simply be ignored. Consider the case where we fail part way through the 
install. We must not flag the partial install (with feature999999.xml) as 
changes or errors on next startup.'

column7: b'When reverting
column8:
sites that used to be the platfrom:/base/ at the time the 
history was created should be reverted as platform:/base/ even when the 
resolved URL is not the same as the current platform:/base/

In particular
column9: the bootstrap entry and primary feature location entry in the \nplatform.cfg file should be set relative to platform:/base/'
