column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #251715 +++\n\nProjects must have stated and demonstrated their intent to join Galileo by the M4+0 date.  Projects do so by adding themselves to this bug and each of the P1 bugs used to define "Must-Do" requirements for train participation.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252789 +++\n\nAt least one person from each project must subscribe to cross-project bug inbox
column8: i.e. edit Bugzilla prefs to watch "cross-project.inbox@eclipse.org". Build team members (or their designated alternates) from each project will provide communication channels: phone
column9: mail
column10: IM
column11: IRC and will be available during the milestone integration periods.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252790 +++\n\nProjects must have an project plan in XML format.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252791 +++\n\nProject representatives must attend the planning meetings and conference calls - you have to be involved to be involved.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252792 +++\n\nProjects must have a written ramp down policy by M6+0
column8: linked in the table above pending inclusion of ramp down element in the XML project plan. (One of the issues identified with this guideline is that its not so much the ramp down policy of how many votes are needed for each bug fix that we need to be consistent on
column9: but rather the meaning of each of the milestones and release candidates. See Platform 3.4 Endgame plan as a guideline. See also Galileo Final Daze.)'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252793 +++\n\nProjects must have their IP approved (a normal Eclipse requirement) and will follow the Eclipse Legal deadlines to do so. See also bug 220977.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252794 +++\n\nProjects should leverage only published APIs of dependencies. As a Release Review requirement
column8: deviations should be listed as part of a migration plan
column9: with bugs listed where APIs need to be provided by dependent projects.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252795 +++\n\nProjects must use Eclipse message bundles unless there are technical reasons not to. (see Message Bundle Conversion Tool and [1])'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252796 +++\n\nProjects must use 4-part version numbers.'
b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252797 +++\n\nAll plug-ins (bundles) must use the true bundle form. That is
column8: provide a manifest.mf file
column9: and not rely on the plugin.xml file being 'translated' into a manifest.mf file at initial startup. See bug 130598. With that
column10: empty plugin.xml files in the presence of a manifest.mf file should not be included in a bundle."

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252798 +++\n\nAll plug-ins must correctly list their required JVM versions in the manifest.mf. See the wiki page about selecting the correct JVM.'

b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252799 +++\n\nProjects must use signed plugins using the Eclipse certificate. Exceptions must be authorized by the planning council for technical reasons.'

b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252800 +++\n\nProjects must use jar'ed plug-ins (with unpack=false) unless authorized by the planning council for technical reasons. Nested jars should be avoided if possible since it creates problems for projects that has dependencies to such plug-ins. The OSGi runtime is fine with it but the compiler is not able to handle classpaths that contain nested jars. In case only one nested jar exists
column8: it is often better to expand the contents of that jar into the root folder (i.e. unnest the jar). If a plug-in contains large files that are frequently used (opened and closed)
column9: a jar'ed plug-in might degrade performance significantly since the file must be decompressed each time it is opened."

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252801 +++\n\nProjects must have build process maturity: scripted
column8: repeatable
column9: and executable by others.'

column7: b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252803 +++\n\nAny new third-party plug-ins that are common between projects must be consumed via Orbit; the final Galileo release will not have duplicate third-party libraries (note that this only applies to identical versions of the libraries; thus if project A requires foo.jar 1.6 and project B uses foo.jar 1.7
column8: that's ok)."

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252804 +++\n\nProjects must optimize their own update site using pack200 to reduce bandwidth utilization and provide a better update experience for users. With the introduction of p2
column8: project update sites must generate metadata (artifact and content repository info).'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252805 +++\n\nMust have new & noteworthy for each milestone. Must be something readable and usable not just a static list of all the bugs
column8: e.g. platform. Corollary: individual new & noteworthy should be linked in to the collective New & Noteworthy.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252806 +++\n\nThis means that users can load any subset of the Galileo projects into Eclipse and each of the loaded projects will pass all the same tests as if it had been loaded independently. If such a problem is identified
column8: the affected projects must fix the problem.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252807 +++\n\nEach project will provide basic capability/activity definitions to allow for their UI contributions to be hidden. These must be provided in a separate plugin/feature to facilitate inclusion/exclusion by consumers in product development.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252808 +++\n\nThe project participates in Babel
column8: meaning it is registered and available for string translation
column9: etc.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252809 +++\n\nMust use  ICU4J.'

b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252813 +++\n\nEach major project (the top-level projects except for the Tools and Technology projects where it is the sub-projects) should have an About dialog icon and contribute to the welcome page.'

b'Created attachment 77791 [details]
Backtrace of the NPE leading to view creation failure

CQ:WIND00103648

Starting Eclipse with RSE I20070816-0800 on Windows XP SP2 host causes RSE view creation failure.  All existing target connections are unavailable and no new ones can be created.  See attached screen captures.  This installation has been used successfully since Aug 28
column8: until today. See attached backtrace
column9: the NPE happens in RSEDOMImporter.java:76
column10:
which corresponds to this line:

    boolean defaultPrivate = getBooleanValue(dom.getAttribute(
        IRSEDOMConstants.ATTRIBUTE_DEFAULT_PRIVATE).getValue());

It looks like the attribute ATTRIBUTE_DEFAULT_PRIVATE does not exist in the DOM in question. Workarounds: Start eclipse on a new empty workspace
column11: or delete the profile dir: <workspace>/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.rse.core/profiles\n\nThis bug is critical because the whole RSE is not usable any more. In spite of the workarounds
column12:
data of the target connections is lost and there seems no way to restore them - only workaround is to delete the entire profile.

Expected behavior:
1.) RSE should ensure that no broken profiles are ever written. Right now
column13: \n    I have no idea how a broken profile could be created.\n2.) When the RSEDOMImporter comes across an exception
column14: that exception should\n    be cought and handled in a way that allows at least the RSE SystemView\n    to come up
column15:
even if it might be empty.

b'Found by using the new API Tooling on org.eclipse.rse.core:
1. SystemFilterSimple leaks "internal" SystemFilter via extends
2. RemoteServerLauncher leaks "internal" ServerLauncher via extends
3. SystemResourceManager leaks "internal" SystemResourceConstants via extends
4. SystemFilterReference leaks "internal" SystemReferencingObject via extends

I think we should adress these for M6 if possible. I will take care of (3) since constant interfaces shouldn't ever be implemented anyways.

Dave's can you please look at 1
column9: 4 and propose a fix - I\'m not sure whether we should promote the "internal" classes to API or do something else e.g. an API Factory method like \n   SystemFilterUtility.getSystemFilterSimple()\nrather than allowing the user to instantiate himself.'

column7: b'With the dstore connection
column8: if a password is expired
column9: password change dialog is shown.  If a user cancels the dialog
column10: the next connect attempt does not work.\n\nWhen the dialog is canceled
column11: StandardCredentialsProvider.promptForNewPassword() throws an OperationCanceledException.  As the result
column12: DStoreConnectorService._isConnecting is left "true"
column13: and the succeeding connect attempt is not processed.'

column8: the service is filled at the line (B)
column9: but (C) is not executed.  For other subsystems
column10: since service is already filled
column11: condition at the line (A) is not satisfied
column12: and (C) is never executed
column13: even if the subsystem has server launcher.'

column7: b'We have run into situations in products where a connect and disconnect can be processing simultaneously in the same connector service. This can result in the connector service throwing an NPE due to its connection reference disappearing.\n\nConnect and disconnect operations are long running and call ISV provided routines. Connect
column8: in particular
column9: can wait indefinitely for user interaction. Thus
column10: connect and disconnect in the connector service must be serialized using safe techniques employing timeouts. Simply making these operations "synchronized" courts deadlock.'

column10: \ntests cannot proceed and that leads to the build hangout. I suspect this causes hangout of the hudson job as well. Currently junit tests are disabled.'

column7:
b'RSEInitJob is scheduled to run without constraint when RSE is initially loaded. Its purpose is to load profiles and to create any initial models objects needed in a new workspace.

Part of loading profiles includes the loading of subsystem configurations. As these are loaded they may trigger code that depends on elements of the workbench that have not fully initialized.

This comes to light in 4.2
column8: perhaps due to some scheduling change in the platform.\n\nThe platform team has recommended that we schedule this job later
column9: perhaps exploiting the org.eclipse.ui.startup extension point.'

b"build 20020517

There are a bunch of files in <install>/eclipse/plugins/

They look like they're from the org.eclipse.platform.source plug-in.

directories."

b'Build 20011116.

- Open a plugin.xml in the PDE plugin editor.
- Select the Runtime page
- select the jar
- hit ALT+D
- it gives focus to the first radiobutton (&Export the entire library)
- it should give focus to the Edit menu

Also
column8: in the Java or Debug perspective
column9:
"&Do not export" conflicts with the 
Debug menu.

Using mnemonics on dialogs is OK
column10: because dialogs don\'t have menus.\nIf you\'re using dialogs in a form in a main application window
column11:
you must be 
careful not to conflict with the menus.
Note that you can't avoid this in general because other plugins may contribute 
menus.
I recommend not using mnemonics in PDE editors
column12:
instead ensuring that tab order 
between the controls works reasonably.

This is an issue for keyboard accessibility.'

column7: b'Build 20020205\n\nIf you open a brand new workspace in this build
column8: the debug.core and debug.ui \nplugins get activated eagerly.  This is because they register a label decorator \nthat is turned on by default.  Maybe this is fine
column9: but I thought I should point \nit out.  One possible solution is to always have decorators turned off by \ndefault
column10:
and it would be up to the user to decide if they want them turned on 
(or they could be turned on implicitly by the first launch/debug attempt).  This 
would be more in line with the "user controlled activation" philosophy of 
eclipse.'

b'New class and interface is beeing added in 20020305-I build
column8: \norg.eclipse.update.configuration.LocalSystemInfo/ ILocalSystemInfoListener. \nThese implement methods for obtaining available space
column9: volume labels and types
column10: \nplus a listener for notification when file system has changed (removable drives
column11: \nmedia
column12:
mount points).

We should support this in the UI as follows:

* install/ update wizard should show available/ required/ to-download space in 
the site-selection list (should show as table with "site"
column13: "available space"
column14: \n"install size" and "to download size" as columns
column15:
the last 2 are delta size 
computation based on the actual site content)

* get volume label
column16: possibly volume type (so we can show different icon) for the \n MyComputer tree
column17:
and any other place where we may be showing "annotated" local 
file paths.

* register local system info change listener ... will be called when things 
change ... for now can simply ignore the change and do a global refresh (as when 
the refresh action is selected)

NOTE: the base java implementation of the above does not do much of anything 
useful
column18: other than providing a default implementation of the apis. The full \nfunction will "come alive" once we add natives. The changes above are enabling \nthis.'

b'We need to support the "arch" tag in the UI.

Also need to actually filter based on the current user environment. The needs to

* by default
column8: only show features that can be installed on the user machine\n* via check
column9:
show all features (regardless of target type)

Core needs to

* by default
column10: only install plugins/ non-plugins that match the user environment\n* via check (passed from UI or accessed in some other way)
column11:
for install of all 
plugins/ non-plugins regardless of target type)

For 2.0 we do not support "custom selection (ie. only what matches user 
environment
column12:
or all).

PS: may be useful to have the "matching" check implemented once as core API 
(likely on feature
column13: pluginentry
column14: nonpluginentry)'

column7:
b'If your text is set to White and your backgrounds black (like in Hight Contrast 
Black) the title of any of the pages in the plugin.xml editor is hidden in the 
white background at the top. Also if the banner font is large the text 
overshoots the title area. 

The title area size should be calculated based on the fonts used.

STEPS
1) Set your Banner font very large (say 24 points) in the Font Preference Page
2) Set your Windows properties to use High Constrast Black
3) Open a plugin.xml. The Text overshoots the title area and the part in the 
title area is not readable.'

b'If your text is set to White and your backgrounds black (like in High Contrast 
Black) the title in the Preview page is hidden in the white background at the 
top. Also if the banner font is large the text overshoots the title area. 

The title area size should be calculated based on the fonts used.

STEPS
1) Set your Header font very large (say 24 points) in the Font Preference Page
2) Set your Windows properties to use High Constrast Black
3) Open a plugin.xml. The Text overshoots the title area and the part in the 
title area is not readable.'

b'20020402 Win2K

I was trying to use the schema editor to create my extension point docs. I was 
trying to enter an example of the markup. If I enter "<example>" into the text 
widget the source page shows it as &lt.example&gt. (which is what I would have 
expected) .... BUT the builder writes it as <example> into the resulting htm l 
and the markup example does not show. Need to be able to distinguish when <> 
tags are entered as formatting information and when they are entered as text.

column9: when I \nsave/ refresh it gets lost. In particulat

column7:
b"It is not possible to get the cursor on the description text in the Extension 
Wizard Selection Dialog.

This poses two problems
1) You cannot read the contents with an assistive technology like JAWS as you 
can't get a cursor there
2) You can't scroll with the keyboard as the widget never gets focus

I would suggest enabling the caret for the description widget"

b'The 4 buttons on version to match do not select an try by default. This creates 
two problems

1) You cannot get to the button group via the keyboard as tab traversal will 
not select anything in a list of radio buttons that do not have a selection
2) There should be an initial selection - this is a general UI design 
requirement.'

b'When you define a new filter on the runtime page of th e maifest editor it is 
not possible to edit the name without  mouse clcik. There should either be a 
rename option in the dialog or the editor should open with some sort of 
keystroke (maybe one of the arrow keys). My suggestion is the rename dialog to 
stay consistent with the rest of the UI.

STEPS
1) Select the Runtime page
2) Tab to the Library Exporting-> Add button
3) Select it with the space bar
4) Cannot edit the new entry without a mouse click'

b"Build 20020416

It is possible to build a self-hosting workspace which can break the running 
host IDE:

1. Import entire host IDE plugins
column8:
choosing NOT to import the plug-ins inside 
the workspace.
2. Connect to a remote server to replace one of the imported plug-in with its 
source version
3. An error is raised
column9: indicating the plug-in couldn't be removed
column10: but if \nexiting and restarting the host IDE
column11: \n    it got removed some essential files."

column7:
b'Many of apparent hyperlinks in the plugin manifest do nothing. 

For instance open the plugin.xml for org.eclipse.ui. and switch to the Overview 
page

No effect hyperlinks. Many move the position but they dont do anything.

1) Class 
2) Extensions (it moves around but never opens anything)
3) Most required plugins
4) Extension Points'

b'If you double click on a preference page entry in the Extensions part of the 
plug in manifest editor you get a widget is disposed exception/


STEPS
1) Open an editor on the plugin.xml for org.eclipse.ui
2) Select the Extensions pane
3) Select org.eclipse.ui.preferencepages
4) Select the first page entry
5) Double click. You will get two error warnings

column7:
b'If you create a plug-in project and then try and create a Preference Page 
extension using the Extensions page you will get a NullPointer exception

STEPS
1) Create a plug-in project
2) Select Extensions
3) Select New -> Extension Templates-> Preference Page
4) Select all of the defaults until it is done

column7: b'Class: org.eclipse.pde.ui.templates.AbstractTemplateSection.java
column8: \nMethod: generateFiles(File
column9: IContainer
column10: boolean
column11: boolean
column12:
IProgressMonitor)

The for-loop goes through all the directories and files and copies a subset 
that is chosen by the subclass of AbstractTemplateSection.
However
column13: in this code
column14: the method erroneously returns as soon as one folder has \nbeen skipped.  Instead
column15: we should process its siblings

column7: b'During template generation
column8: if the bin folder has files as "siblings"
column9: these \nfiles are erroneously copied as they are without processing
column10:
because the binary 
flag in org.eclipse.pde.ui.templates.AbstractTemplateSection.generateFiles(...) 
is not reset after the bin folder and its children are copied.

A suggested fix is to replace:
 if (isOkToCreateFile(member)) {
  copyFile(member
column11: dst
column12: binary
column14: dst
column15: binary
column16: monitor);\n }'

column7: b"There doesn't seem to be a way to add the feaure icon through the Information \nEditor pane of a feature. The only was is to modify the source directly."

b'Eclipse 2.0 needs to have source in alternative locations (not alongside the 
plug-ins). PDE needs to support this alternative locations (using a preference 
page) and also add a fixed location at ECLIPSE_HOME/src. When looking for 
source
column8: the following algorithm will be used:\n\n1) All the locations specified in the preference page
column9:
starting with 
ECLIPSE_HOME/src
2) As a sibling of the JAR file (as today)

Alternative locations can be modified. The default location (ECLIPSE_HOME/src) 
cannot be removed or altered.'

b'Internal test build (20020507)

The org.eclipse.ui plug-in has sprouted a new fragment org.eclipse.ui.win32.

0. Fresh workspace
1. Import org.eclipse.ui and org.eclipse.ui.win32

Observe: 

(1) Problem Occurred "Plug-in Import"
(2) Details "Problem while importing "org.eclipse.ui". Name collision.

Expectation:
- there should not be any error here
- error message should be more meaningful than "Plug-in Import"

2. Delete both plug-ins and content
3. Import org.eclipse.ui
4. Import org.eclipse.ui.win32

Observe: No problems doing them one at at time.

5. Delete both plug-ins and content
6. Import org.eclipse.ui.win32
7. Import org.eclipse.ui

Observe: No problems with this order either.

One interesting property about org.eclipse.ui.win32 is that it must be compiled
*after* org.eclipse.ui. (Although I don't see how that would matter.)'

column8: it should read it from\nthe same place that the workbench does
column9: namely from the about.ini\n(.properties
column10: .mappings) files in the plug-in for the primary feature.\nThe workbench will NOT be providing API for this (and the\nupdate manager must not access workbench internal).'

column7:
b'We need an ability to link to an extension install that was natively installed 
AFTER our product was installed.

Suggested UI interaction was to drill down using MyComputer to the extension 
install directory
column8:
and then provide a popup to link to it. Only extension 
installs can be linked to. An extension install directory is a directory 
containing an .eclipseextension file (as per Jim's spec). If the user selects 
to link to it
column9:
we actually need to create a "local site" that points to the 
eclipse/ subdirectory of the extension install.

There is a need for a corresponding "unlink" capability. The simplest way to 
implement this is likely as a popup off a local site in the Configuration view. 
Only extension sites explicitly linked via MyComputer should enable 
the "unlink" action.

Note: this needs isRemovable() on LocalSite
column10:
that 
(1) checks that there is .eclipseextension one level above the local site
(2) checks that the extension is not linked via link file (see 
PlatformConfiguration.isExternallyLinkedSite() ... need to make it public)

The last 2 are core changes.'

column7: b'We should by default select the location we will use for installing updates
column8:
and only show the install wizard page if needed.

The default "rules" are:

* always install updates into the same location the currently-configured 
feature resides in
* if we are installing a feature
column9: there are not configured versions of it
column10: but \nthere are unconfigured version
column11: we pick the location of the unconfigured \nfeatures (latest version of it)\n* if we are installing a feature and there are no other loca versions
column12:
it is 
installed into the "product" site

We only show the wizard site selection page if the default location cannot be 
used (cannot be written
column13: is out of space
column14: etc).'

disabled.  The wizard must enabled them to avoid compile errors.

The word "enabled" needs to be changed to "enable".  (correction)'

b'Build 0531
Create a new plugin project using wizard.
Select Plugin with a view template.
Accept all defaults.
Finish
Instructions to run are incorrect (***see attached bitmap).  The instructions 
reference a Debug menu which does not exist
column8: and if you click the run link
column9:
you 
are left in a dialog that has a grayed out Run button so it is not possible to 
run the plugin (unless of course you know the secret - that you have to make a 
new configuration - but this is too obscure for a beginning user).

I suggest something like the following:
Change the instructions to tell people they can run or debug the plugin by 
using Run->Run As->Runtime Workbench or Run->Debug As->Runtime Workbench 
respectively.  This allows them to easily run it while bypassing the confusing 
Run... dialog which is a more advanced feature.  Either remove the run link 
altogether
column10: or explain that if they click on this they will be able to set \nadvanced parameters.'

column7:
b"Search categories for 'plug-in' and 'update' searches are currently useless 
when created by users because the category GUI lacks widgets to configure them. 
Need to:

1) Make the 'Add' button working in 'plug-in' search so that users can create 
searches that return features that contain plug-ins with specified IDs and 
versions.

2) Make the 'Add' button working in 'update' search so that users can create 
searches that return new updates to selected features (this allows users to 
create subset of a full search)."
b'Widgets (buttons
column8: labels for text fields etc.) should not have mnemonics \nbecause they conflict with the main menu mnemonics.'

column7:
b'build 2002-06-01 on Linux-motif and Linux GTK on RedHat 7.2.

- start Eclipse
- create new PDE project HelloWorld and use the template and all defaults
- select Run As -> Runtime workbench
- Runtime workbench won't start. Motif says it can't find the swt.jar from the
fragment. GTK says NoClassDefFoundError on an SWT class.

workaround:
- go to the launch configuration for HelloWorld
- select "Plugins and Fragments"
- check the box beside "Workspace plugins" (even though your project is already
checked)
- Run the runtime workbench
- works ok'

b'F2

The JDT feature has the standard eclipse 32x32 image marking the feature.
This image shows up in the update manager when browsing features.

The PDE feature should have the standard eclipse 32x32 image
too.

Candidate for Fix Pass 2.'

column7: b'I just wasted *a lot* of time trying to debug my plugin
column8:
only to realize that I 
wasn't running the code I thought I was due to some "out of sync" error on one 
of my plugins.

How I got in this state was approximately:

- had binary projects imported
- checked out projects from CVS overtop
- self hosting debug

I think during checkout one had failed somehow -- I didn't have any classes.  
But I thought since I was actually checking out a branch I had just picked an 
empty one.  So I repeated and got content.  Not sure
column9: that was yesterday.\n\nAll the time
column10: it turned out that that project had some PDE "Out of sync" \nerror.  After much failed debugging I was finally able to show that my \nplugin.xml wasn\'t even being used
column11: my old one was still.\n\nGiven that
column12:
we thought to look in run configuration.

Its completely unacceptable that the user should be able to execute self 
hosting if the code they are looking at in the development environment is 
somehow not the code they are executing (unless they took advanced steps to do 
so).  At least if there is an error that PDE is aware of they should:

1. warn you when launching
2. write something in the .log'

b'The update support currently allows a feature to be installed (natively or \nusing update) on multiple local "sites". When the user selects an update for \nthis feature
column8:
update manager picks one of these and updates it. There are two 
problems associated with this:

(1) we do not offer the user the choice of which to update (currently we pick 
one of the sites
column9:
likely the first one we find containing the feature)
(2) we should give the user the choice to actually apply the update to multiple 
(all) installed feature dups.

Also see bug 20867 for a scenario (with attached test cases) where this was 
causing a problem.'

column7: b'If a root feature \xe2\x80\x9cincludes\xe2\x80\x9d another feature for the purpose of blocking its \nupdates
column8:
then it should not be possible to update the inner feature using the 
update manager perspectives.

(note: there is a separate pr indicating that tying inclusion and support 
availability together is a problem)'

column7:
b'During installation an installer  should be able to precheck whether a given 
workbench based install meets the necessary requirements. Otherwise
- a product has to lay down every component (e.g. JDT may not be in the target 
workbench but an installer can't safely tell)
- the installer might complete and then on startup it may fail due to missing 
requirements

One of the available install/update documents indicates the product should warn 
the user on install that the extension "may not" be configured as prerequisites 
are not met. This is not good.

The right answer here is for eclipse to support a way for installers to detect 
that things will be ok rather than a blind install. It could start headless
column8: do \na dummy run through what is required/included and report back on \nsuccess/failure.'

column7: b"If a user tries to do a query for available updates and ones of the sites\nentered is not valid
column8:
the search ends as soon as the invalid url is found and
non of the other urls are searched. This is especially a problem if an installed
feature has given an invalid update tag in it's feature.xml as there is no way
to stop the search of this tag - short of editing the feature.xml file and
removing the update tag.

Steps to recreate:
1) Set up a feature that has an update tag that points to an invalid url
2) bookmark a valid site
3) go to Available Updates and under Scope Settings select only 'Search
bookmarked sites'
4) Click 'Search Now'
5) This will fail on the invalid url and not search the valid site"

column7: b'When the user is using the Update Manager to add a new feature to their product
column8:
after they accept the user license they then get offered a page where they can
select where to put the feature. The list includes the product location as well
as the extension(s). In the case of our product
column9:
we ALWAYS want our features to
be put with our extension. We have used the collaction-affinity tag to enforce
this. The problem is that even though the feature has used the tag to say where
it wants to beinstalled
column10: the user can change this. To make matters worse
column11:
the UI
that offers them where to put the feature is very confusing and can very easily
be used improperly.

If a feature has a collocation-affinity tag
column12: the user should not see this\nInstall Location page'

column7: b'When expanding Root 1.0.1
column8: Bogus 1.0.1 is disable'

column7: b'If feature A is included as part of feature B
column8:
there is no way to update feature
A independent of feature B using the Available Updates page as feature A will
not be listed under the Query settings. Even if feature A is added independently
at first
column9:
as soon as it is included in another feature we can no longer update
it independently.

In our product we have the case where we have base tooling that we want to
ensure is loaded when a given runtime is added via the update mechanism. The
same tooling is pointed to from multiple runtimes. We are using the include tag
to get the tooling in
column10: but we want to be able to update the tooling feature\nseparately.'

b'We need to modify the way we parse feature.xml and site.xml archives by \nincluding the validation step against the respective DTD files. The parsers we \nuse (SAXParser) support validation
column8: but it has to be enabled. For backward \ncompatibility
column9: we need to tolerate files that are missing the DTD declaration.\n\nWe will place DTDs in Update Core plug-in (in the dtd directory)
column10:
and require 
that users add the following in the file:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE site SYSTEM "dtd/site.dtd">

and for features:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE feature SYSTEM "dtd/feature.dtd">

We could use 'PUBLIC' doctype instead
column11:
but that would require that we place the 
dtds on Eclipse.org. That means that any slowdown in eclipse.org server will 
cause problems when reading the files. That is why we will use 'SYSTEM' which 
means that we will provide the SYSTEM location. 

To enable the server to validate the files
column13: true);\n   parser.setFeature("http://apache.org/xml/features/validation/dynamic"
column15:
the second makes it dynamic i.e. 
validation is performed only if the DTD is present (for backward compatibility).

In order to set the DTD location
column17:
so all the DTDs will prepend this 
location to the value defined in the DOCTYPE declaration. 

We will place site.dtd and feature.dtd in the dtd directory and add dtd/ 
directory to the bin distribution (bin.includes in build.properties).

PDE will be modified to add the DOCTYPE declaration to all the new feature.xml 
and site.xml files it creates
column18: but not before Update Core supports it \n(otherwise
column19: PDE would generate features and sites that Update would choke on).'

column7: b'If an optional feature is not installed
column8:
an attempt to patch the feature that 
includes the optional feature fails after pressing the "Install" button with 
the following message:
(X) Requested operation cannot be performed because it would invalidate the 
current configuration.
The details say:
<feature name> (version): Older version of feature "optional feature name 
(version)" must be present for a patch to be applied.

I have a simple example of this that I can supply.  The feature hierarchy looks 
like this:
   + master 1.0.0 (root feature)
   |
   '--+ ftrA 1.0.0  (feature that will be patched)
      |
      '--- ftrA.opt 1.0.0  (optional feature)

So feature "master" includes feature "ftrA" which optionally 
includes "ftrA.opt".  Now if a new patch (fix1) is attempted to install and has 
the following feature.xml
column9:
it will fail as described:
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
    <feature id="fix1" image="wsFeatUpdate.jpg"
        label="%featureName" provider-name="abc" version="1.0.0"
        colocation-affinity="master">
        <description>fix1 will install ftrA version 1.0.0.1</description>
        <license url="%licenseURL">This is for test purposes</license>
        <includes id="ftrA" match="equivalent" version="1.0.0.1"/>
        <requires>
            <import feature="master" version="1.0.0" patch="true"/>
        </requires>
        <plugin id="fix1" version="1.0.0"/>
    </feature>

Since ftrA.opt is optional
column10:
it should be acceptable to update ftrA independent 
of it.  It doesn't seem to matter if the patch="true" attribute is set.

This is a blocker because this blocks us from updating our product in the field.'

column7:
b"Every update operation is checked in 'ActivityConstraints' class where 'before' 
and 'after' states are computed to verify that the proposed operation will 
result in a valid state.

In case of an install or update
column8:
it works as follows:

1) It computes the 'before' list. It contains all the local features currently 
installed in the product.
2) It computes 'add' list. It contains all the remote features that will be 
added.
3) It computes 'remove' list. It contains all the local features that will be 
removed from the product.

The order is:

after_list = before_list + add_list - remove_list

This algorithm has a flaw in the actual order. 'Before' list contains only 
local features
column9: while the 'add' lists contains only the remote features. After \nthe first addition
column10: the resulting list contains a mix of local and remote. When \nthe 'remove' list is removed
column11: it removes more features than it should thanks to \nthe behaviour of 'IFeature.equals()'. Since this method simply compares id and \nversion of a feature
column12: it returns true when a local and a remote feature object \nwith the same id and version are compared. We use 'ArrayList'.removeAll' and in \nthis process
column13:
both the local and the remote feature is removed from the 'after' 
list.

Although 'ActivityConstraints' does not do the actual work - it just makes sure 
the operation will result in a legal state - it prevents the install from 
happening.

The fix is simple - change the order:

after_list = before_list - remove_list + add_list

Since 'before_list' and 'remove_list' are compatible i.e. both contain only the 
local features
column14:
the result will be as desired and no excessive removal can 
happen.

This is not a new problem - the same code existed in 2.0 release - we simply 
found about it now. It is a very subtle issue and we stared at the code for a 
while before realizing what happened."

column7: b'ActivityConstraints delta validator takes into account features that will be \nenabled by a session delta
column8: as well as features that will be disabled. However
column9:
it does not take into account that e-fixes for the disabled features must also 
be disabled. This create a false validation error that prevents delta from 
being applied.'

column7: b"When a Label widget is in a parent that has its background explicitly set
column8:
scrolling the parent in a ScrolledComposite can cause the label to only
partially repaint (sometimes it goes away completely).

To reproduce:

1) Check out org.eclipse.ui.forms and org.eclipse.ui.forms.examples from HEAD
2) Launch second Eclipse instance
3) Customize perspective so that 'Form Editors' menu shows up on the menu bar
4) Launch the Simple Form Editor and switch to Flow page
5) Scroll the page vertically. Observe how some labels in sections flicker and
partially go away while scrolling.

I tried to figure out the reason and so far found out that it has to do wih the
background painting of the parent. To confirm
column9:
open 'Section.java' in
org.eclipse.ui.forms.widgets package and comment out the method 'onPaint' (this
method paints the blue section behind the section label). You will notice that
the problem stops.

Similar problem has been noticed with cheat sheets. They too use the same base
class (expandable composite) and set the background to explicit color object. As
cheat sheet sections expand
column10: collapse and otherwise layout
column11:
some portions of the
text go away.

There is no rhyme or reason to this - it is completely random.

This is a serious problem becuase it affects all the sections in all the PDE
multi-page editors on GTK. In addition
column12: it affects cheat sheets."

Capabilities page is configured in the product plug-in and text is

1) Dialog we put up when turning the capability filter off must use text that 
matches the preference page (both in the webapp and in the help view)

2) We should offer a link to open the preference page

3) Injected information for capability page must also be pluggable in a 
similar way.'

column7: b'At the moment

injected HTML for a disabled topic is in UTF-8 charset. This 
will fail on any translated page that does not use this charset. We must 
detect the charset string of the source page and use it to inject the correct 
bytes.'

column12:
you are no longer
able to type in the wizard.  This happens because the dialog is automatically
switched to a modal dialog by the following line in Shell.createHandle:

    if ((style & SWT.ON_TOP) == 0) modal |= (parent != null && (parent.style &
bits) != 0);


If this hack in SWT is removed
column13: then you cannot click in the dynamic help\ndialog.  Basically
column14: GTK+ does not appear to support (at very first naive glance)\ntyping anywhere but in the modal dialog
column15: and it cannot handle two modal dialogs.'

b'This applies to all eclipse 3.1 versions and the current HEAD.\n\nIn FormToolkit.initializeBorder()
column8: the existence of a theme manifest is checked to determine whether or not the native widgets will supply the desired border appearance.  However
column9: the logic in this test is not always correct.  The file name "javaw.exe.manifest" is hard-coded in the method.  Eclipse can be executed with \'java.exe\' instead of \'javaw.exe\'.  It is also conceivable (though probably improbable) that someone would rename the java executed to something else entirely.  I noticed the issue while I was using \'java.exe\' to be able to see any messages sent to stdout.  The toolkit should instead look for a manifest file corresponding to the executable that actually launched eclipse.  A rather ugly (appearance-wise) scenario occurs if javaw.exe.manifest exists but java.exe.manifest does not and java.exe is used to launch eclipse -- the forms will use SWT.BORDER yielding the 3D border of classic windows in the form.\n\nBug #110310 is related to this one.'

column7: b'xdc.runtime docs for XDCtools 3.20 release need to be updated in RTSCpedia. In particular the compatibility break in the Logger API should be clearly documented. Also specific instructions should be provided for the following usecases\n(a) Users trying to consume modules developed with XDCtools 3.1x with XDCtools 3.20\n(b) Users trying to consume modules developed with XDCtools 3.20 with XDCtools 3.1x'
b'XDCtools is delivered as a big bundle containing target content packages
column8: tools and documentation. This increases the size of the product download and also requires frequent releases of the entire product. The XDCtools integration in eclipse should support a mechanism for updating parts of the product. This will allow customers to start with a "lite" product and then pickup updates that are relevant for their system.'

With the new menu structure most of our actions are now selection change 
listeners. Because some of our view send out selection changes asynchronously 
(see bug 14092) we have to check if out actions must be more fault tolerant 
regarding existing test. For example we can receive a selection change event 
for an element that already got deleted.'

column7: b'Can\'t update classpath more than once with F1 on linux/motif.\n\nDialogbox with "Resource /home does not exist." appears when clicking ok.'

b'we are now getting new JavaElementDeltas when a working copy is created. This 
delta is fired when an editor is opened on a resource for the first time and 
results in flushing the undo stack.

To test you can use the dirty indicator in JUnit as a reference (it uses 
similar code) as the undo manager (TestRunnerViewPart.DirtyListener).

When you have fixed the UndoManager please assign the back back to me.'

b"RC1 
 
The change method signature and extract method refactoring shouldn't use a cell 
editor and table cursor for editing the data. Both concepts are unreliable on other 
platforms (MacOS X and Linux-GTK). We should have a full Edit dialog instead. 
 
See bug 33017 and bug 33008"

b'- new file B.txt
- change B.txt in the filesystem
- open B.txt in Eclipse
- it gives an error dialog: "Problems Opening Editor" / "File has changed since 
last synchronization".

A: This case will happen often
B: What is synchronization?  We don't use that term in the UI anymore.
C: It doesn't show how to rectify the situation.  How is a novice user supposed 
to know to do a refresh local?
D: It's not necessary.  There's only one content which can be seen in the 
editor.  It could just do a refresh for you and open it.

NOTES:

NE (5/25/01 1:25:37 PM) 
 Are there any disadvantages to just doing a refresh?  Need to check 
with a Core person.

DS (5/29/01 8:43:27 PM)
 I will write an operation to do a refresh ( with user confirmation ) if 
the resource has
 changed.  This operation can be reused throughout desktop in open 
editor
column8: copy
column9: move
column10: \n delete
column11: etc.\n\n Out of sync states to deal with = modify
column12:
delete

DS (5/29/01 9:24:37 PM)
 According to Rodrigo there is no way to see if a file is out of sync.  
Perhaps it would
 involve doing everything a localRefresh does
column13:
but without doing the 
localRefresh.

KH (5/30/2001 2:50:50 PM)
 Local refresh will cause builders to run. We should NOT do this for 
free.'

column7: b'- new file B.txt\n- modify it in the editor
column8:
but don't save
- change B.txt in the filesystem
- save B.txt in Eclipse
- it gives an error dialog: "Save problems" / "Internal Error: Reason: File has 
changed since last synchronization."

A: This case will happen often
B: What is synchronization?  We don't use that term in the UI anymore.
C: It doesn't show how to rectify the situation.  How is a novice user supposed 
to know to do a refresh local?
D: It's not an internal error.  Eclipse didn't fail (it is
column9: however
column10: failing to \nmeet the user\'s expectations.)\nE: It throws away the changes made in Eclipse!  This is really bad
column11:
as it loses 
the user's work.  

It should notify that the file has changed since it was opened
column12: and offer to:\n 1 - save anyway
column13:
overwriting other changes
 2 - abandon changes made in editor
 3 - compare differences and merge

For 1 and 2
column14: it should not really lose the other contents
column15: but put them in the \nrecycle bin or local history\nso they can be recovered later if the user makes the wrong choice here
column16:
or 
needs them later.


NOTES:

NE (5/25/01 1:35:04 PM) 
 Similar behaviour if file has been deleted in filesystem.
 The editor contents are lost.
 In this case
column17: it should just save the editor contents.'

b"Version: WSWB 1.0 + wswb rollup 1

Product: WSDD 

When you try to use the software update mechanism with rollup 1
column8: it does not \nstart up
column9:
instead you get an internal error. 
This is very severe for WSDD as we are using the software update as a basis of 
our product. This is currently a stop ship item for us. 

Steps to recreate: 
1) Install and start WSWB 1.0 
2) Activate the Software Updates menu item 
        - Perspective -> Customize... 
        - expand Other 
        - select Software Updates 
3) Select Help -> Software Updates 
        - the Software Updates window comes up fine 
4) Close WSWB and install rollup 1 
5) Start WSWB

        - you get an error dialog

column7: b'There is currently no pre-move or post-move notification for a project. \nNotification is provided for files
column8: but not for projects.\nWe have plugins which are dependent upon the location of projects
column9:
and 
therefore must be notified the moment a project has been moved. 

We require at the very least either a pre or post-move notification for a 
project.'

column7: b'Eclipse provides default behavior for the copy/move/rename/delete operations. \nThe default behavior is not sufficient for some user plugins. Also
column8:
the plugins 
do not receive any pre-notification of these events. We therefore request one 
of the following changes:

1) Provide a mechanism (through extension points) to allow plugins to extend 
the behavior of these operation (similar to trapping global actions)

AND/OR

2) Provide a mechanism (the resource change events) to pre-notify the plugins 
of these events.'

Japanese characters in its name.

1. Create a file with Japanese characters in its name in a project 
directory

Bye

column7: b"Customers have been reporting problems trying to build large applications \n(i.e.  more than 35 projects).\nAlthough there are several scenarios that this problems occurs
column8: the simpliest \nway to think of this is \nthen a customer starts with a new workspace
column9:
loads the source of the large 
application and selects Rebuild All.
The result is a few thousand errors in the task list.  The same source can be 
built using JAVAC (i.e builds
with out any errors).

The difference in the build results between using JAVAC and Eclipse appears to 
related to circular dependencies.
The reasons for having circular dependencies in these large applications varies 
with each customer.  From the
customer's point of view they have many developers using this structure and 
their nightly builds (using JAVAC)
build without any errors.  Thus they expect the IDE to be able to build the 
same code without errors.  In addition
waiting for V2 of Eclipse is not a alternative for these customers.  Also 
building individual projects is also not
alternaitve since it can take a long
column10:
long time to get all the parts build 
without errors using elipse.

To demonstrate the problem I have created a testcase using 6 projects.  

Here are the steps using Eclipse:

0)  Turn off Automatic build on Windows->Perferences

1)  Create the projects:
 CycleDB
 CycleMain
 CyclePeople
 CyclePolicy
 CycleServer
 CycleUtil

2)  Import from the file system into CycleDB the following:
 ivjdab.jar
 vajAS400ET.jar
 vajrmi.jar
 dax.jar
    Import from the file system into CycleServer the following:
 VAJSQLJ.jar

    The jars files are in RTJars.zip 
 
3)  Import the java source into each project from the corresponding jars files 
(which are in Cycle.zip).
    Ensure that the .classpath file is replaced during the import. 

4)  Select Project->Rebuild All

The result will be a few hundred build errors.

Here are the steps using JAVAC:

1) Ensure you have a 1.3 JDK installed

2) Place the bld.cmd (which is in Cycle.zip) in the Eclpise workspace directory

3) From the command line remove all the class files in the workspace directory 
tree
   (for example issue del *.class /s from the workspace directory)

4) Ensure JAVAC is on your path

5) Run bld.cmd
 
The result is a successful build with no errors.

The zip files Cycle and RTJars are available on request."

column7:
b'M5 + patches

1. Launch eclipse 1.0.
Create a project p with a class test.Main including a main method with the 
text "System.out".
This should give you 1 error in the task list.
2. exit eclipse
3. launch eclipse 2.0 and point at the workspace created above.
Eclipse 2.0 notices that you have an old workspace and gives you two choices:
A. convert the project and proceed
B. cancel and leave the workspace as is.

If you select B
column8: cancel and leave the workspace as is
column9:
you are left in a state 
where the workspace is not readable by Eclipse 2.0 nor Eclipse 1.0.
Eclipse 1.0 thinks the project p has been deleted;
Eclipse 2.0 thinks the project p is closed and doesn't want to open it.'

column7: b'According to the ICommand documentation
column8: you can add arguments where the key is \na string
column9:
but the value is null. This generates a .project file something like:
<<snip>>
 <buildSpec>
  <buildCommand>
   <name>org.eclipse.jdt.core.javabuilder</name>
   <arguments>
    <dictionary>
     <key>keyOnly</key>
     <value></value>
    </dictionary>
   </arguments>
  </buildCommand>
 </buildSpec>
<<snip>>

column7:
b'build 200205291235

Setup
- Start eclipse.
- Open the about dialog
- Observe: There is a main image.
- Exit eclipse.

1. Copy the file <install>/eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_2.0.0/eclipse_lg.gif
down into an NL-specific subdirectory; i.e.
column8:
move it to
<install>/eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_2.0.0/nl/en/eclipse_lg.gif

2. Delete <install>/eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_2.0.0/eclipse_lg.gif

3. Edit <install>/eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_2.0.0/about.ini
Change the value of the aboutImage property:
aboutImage=$nl$/eclipse_lg.gif

4. Start eclipse
5. Open the about dialog

Observe: There is no main image.

Expectation: It should have found it in.

6. Edit <install>/eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_2.0.0/about.ini
Change the value of the aboutImage property:
aboutImage=nl/en/eclipse_lg.gif
7. Start eclipse
8. Open the about dialog

Observe: There is a main image again.

This suggests that the UI is correctly passing the entire path 
to IPluginDescriptor.find
column9: but that the "$nl$" path segment is not being \nhandled correctly.'

column7:
b'All externalized strings for a fragment.xml (typically the fragment name
and the provider name) must be placed in the plugin.properties file (!) of the 
corresponding plug-in.

There is no such thing as a fragment.properties file.

Here is an example that gives the general idea of it should look:

in the org.eclipse.foo.win32 fragment
   fragment.xml  
       <fragment
          id="org.eclipse.foo.win32"
          name="%win32FragmentName"
          provider-name="%providerName"
          version="2.0.0"
          plugin-id="org.eclipse.foo"
          plugin-version="2.0.0" /> 

in the org.eclipse.foo.linux fragment
   fragment.xml  
       <fragment
          id="org.eclipse.foo.linux"
          name="%linuxFragmentName"
          provider-name="%providerName"
          version="2.0.0"
          plugin-id="org.eclipse.foo"
          plugin-version="2.0.0" /> 

in the org.eclipse.foo plug-in
   plugin.xml  
      <plugin
          id="org.eclipse.foo"
          name="%pluginName"
          provider-name="%providerName"
          version="2.0.0" />
   plugin.properties
      pluginName=Foo
      providerName=Eclipse.org
      win32FragmentName=Foo for Windows
      linuxFragmentName=Foo for Linux'
b'In Eclipse 1.0
column8:
Core runtime's "$nl$" mechanism was implemented
incorrectly.  A path like "$nl$/foo.txt" would end up looking in
the following locale-specific locations under the plug-in (including
fragments)
column9:
assuming the current locale is "fr_FR_EURO":
    nl/fr_FR_EURO/foo.txt
    nl/fr_FR/foo.txt
    nl/fr/foo.txt
    foo.text
This is incorrect. It should have been looking in this sequence
of locations:
    nl/fr/FR/EURO/foo.txt
    nl/fr/FR/foo.txt
    nl/fr/foo.txt
    foo.text

This problem has been corrected For Eclipse 2.0

However
column10: for backwards compatibility
column11:
the old 1.0 way should be supported
as well (considered as deprecated). The implementation should look in this 
order:
    nl/fr/FR/EURO/foo.txt
    nl/fr_FR_EURO/foo.txt
    nl/fr/FR/foo.txt
    nl/fr_FR/foo.txt
    nl/fr/foo.txt
    foo.text'

put in a PR about it.  It would help serviceability.'

2. I can't remember
column9: something else

column12:
or if I 
asked for the wrong thing.

Need to fix for F3 since at present we do no site validation due to exists() 
being bogus for sites.'

column8:

meta data. The SafeFileOutputStream will just throw an exception in that case
which is ignored.

b'If you create a project/folder with foreign characters you can not add a file 
to the folder.  

Reproduction Steps:

1. Select Regional Options from the Control Panel
2. In the General Tab select Cyrillic and Hebrew
column8:
then OK
3. After reboot select the Keyboard from the Control Panel
4. In Input Locales select "Add..." then add Russian then Hebrew and click OK
5. Install eclipse-platform-GM6-win32.zip
6. Open Eclipse
7. Select HE from the item on the task bar
8. Create a project using Hebrew (try ABCD on English keyboard which produces 
Hebrew chars when HE is selected)
9. Create a folder using Hebrew (BCDE was used)
10. Try to create a file (using CDEF) you get and Error saying the file already 
exists and it fails.  Though the file appears to be created in the file system.

Expected behaviour: the file is created correctly and appears in the navigator.

Try with Russian same behaviour'

column7: b'Build tested: Eclipse 2.0 G/A\nOn Platform : Windows 2000
column8:
Japanese edition

Eclipse has problems with Japanese characters in some cases. Exporting a file 
with Japanese
characters in its name to a Zip file results in the filename being altered. 
Exporting the same files to
a file system worked without a problem. To see an example of this
column9: look at the \nattached bitmap\n(ZipFileVsFileSystem.bmp)
column10:
it shows the same .java and .class files as they are 
exported to the file
system and to a Zip file.

As well
column11:
asking Eclipse to create a new Java class that is in Japanese 
characters causes the file
to be created successfully but the class name is not added to the file (see
EclipseWithJapaneseChars.bmp).'

column8: win2k
column9:
j9

Eduardo and Jeff have some suggestions for classloading enhancements that we 
should look at. This includes having a file with package name prefixes in it to 
give the class loader a hint as to whether or not the class that it is looking 
for will be in this plug-in.

We should look at integrating this code into DelegatingURLClassLoader and its 
friends.'

column8: win2k
column9:
j9

PluginDescriptor.getResourceBundle() asks the plug-in class loader for its 
classpath. This causes the class loader to be instantiated and then the 
classpath to be calculated.

1). We are able to calculate this classpath without creating the class loader
2). We should cache this value so if we create the class loader later we 
already have it calculated'

column7:
b'build i0324:0800

- old workspace
- start Eclipse
- legacty preferences are converted to new prefs
- exit Eclipse
- start Eclipse
- Note that preferences have reverted to their defaults

We are not obeying our own rules. We tell people that when they change
preference values they must flush the changes to disk. Immediately after we load
the legacy values and merge with new values we should be flushing the changes.'

b'Build I20040420

IProject
 public IPath getPluginWorkingLocation(IPluginDescriptor plugin);

This method is an API dependency on old core runtime API.
IPluginDescriptor is defined in org.eclipse.core.runtime itself
column8:
but its
only implementation is in org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility.
This means that a client will only be able to access this functionality in a 
world where org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility is present.
This seems too harsh.

This project could be addressed by adding to IProject:
 public IPath getPluginWorkingLocation(String pluginId);
and the old method marked similiar to IPluginDescriptor.

More generally
column9: the core.resource API should be reviewed for any other places \nwhere old core runtime stuff shows up in the API.'

column7:
b"build i0920.

right now:
- client modifies preferences via the new node APIs
- client calls Plugin.savePluginPreferences
- code is short-circuited to skip since the object hasn't been created yet

need to:
- always save the instance scope prefs in the preference forwarder
- ensure the behaviour of the dirty bit in the forwarder is good"

b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #251715 +++\n\nProjects must have stated and demonstrated their intent to join Galileo by the M4+0 date.  Projects do so by adding themselves to this bug and each of the P1 bugs used to define "Must-Do" requirements for train participation.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252789 +++\n\nAt least one person from each project must subscribe to cross-project bug inbox
column8: i.e. edit Bugzilla prefs to watch "cross-project.inbox@eclipse.org". Build team members (or their designated alternates) from each project will provide communication channels: phone
column9: mail
column10: IM
column11: IRC and will be available during the milestone integration periods.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252790 +++\n\nProjects must have an project plan in XML format.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252791 +++\n\nProject representatives must attend the planning meetings and conference calls - you have to be involved to be involved.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252792 +++\n\nProjects must have a written ramp down policy by M6+0
column8: linked in the table above pending inclusion of ramp down element in the XML project plan. (One of the issues identified with this guideline is that its not so much the ramp down policy of how many votes are needed for each bug fix that we need to be consistent on
column9: but rather the meaning of each of the milestones and release candidates. See Platform 3.4 Endgame plan as a guideline. See also Galileo Final Daze.)'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252793 +++\n\nProjects must have their IP approved (a normal Eclipse requirement) and will follow the Eclipse Legal deadlines to do so. See also bug 220977.'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252794 +++\n\nProjects should leverage only published APIs of dependencies. As a Release Review requirement
column8: deviations should be listed as part of a migration plan
column9: with bugs listed where APIs need to be provided by dependent projects.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252795 +++\n\nProjects must use Eclipse message bundles unless there are technical reasons not to. (see Message Bundle Conversion Tool and [1])'
b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252796 +++\n\nProjects must use 4-part version numbers.'
b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252797 +++\n\nAll plug-ins (bundles) must use the true bundle form. That is
column8: provide a manifest.mf file
column9: and not rely on the plugin.xml file being 'translated' into a manifest.mf file at initial startup. See bug 130598. With that
column10: empty plugin.xml files in the presence of a manifest.mf file should not be included in a bundle."

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252798 +++\n\nAll plug-ins must correctly list their required JVM versions in the manifest.mf. See the wiki page about selecting the correct JVM.'

b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252799 +++\n\nProjects must use signed plugins using the Eclipse certificate. Exceptions must be authorized by the planning council for technical reasons.'

b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252800 +++\n\nProjects must use jar'ed plug-ins (with unpack=false) unless authorized by the planning council for technical reasons. Nested jars should be avoided if possible since it creates problems for projects that has dependencies to such plug-ins. The OSGi runtime is fine with it but the compiler is not able to handle classpaths that contain nested jars. In case only one nested jar exists
column8: it is often better to expand the contents of that jar into the root folder (i.e. unnest the jar). If a plug-in contains large files that are frequently used (opened and closed)
column9: a jar'ed plug-in might degrade performance significantly since the file must be decompressed each time it is opened."

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252801 +++\n\nProjects must have build process maturity: scripted
column8: repeatable
column9: and executable by others.'

column7: b"+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252803 +++\n\nAny new third-party plug-ins that are common between projects must be consumed via Orbit; the final Galileo release will not have duplicate third-party libraries (note that this only applies to identical versions of the libraries; thus if project A requires foo.jar 1.6 and project B uses foo.jar 1.7
column8: that's ok)."

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252804 +++\n\nProjects must optimize their own update site using pack200 to reduce bandwidth utilization and provide a better update experience for users. With the introduction of p2
column8: project update sites must generate metadata (artifact and content repository info).'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252805 +++\n\nMust have new & noteworthy for each milestone. Must be something readable and usable not just a static list of all the bugs
column8: e.g. platform. Corollary: individual new & noteworthy should be linked in to the collective New & Noteworthy.'

column8: the affected projects must fix the problem.'

b"If you have a directory expanded and refresh it's parent the sub directory will be collapsed after the refresh.  This happens only on Remote Systems not on Local.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Expand a directory inside another directory.
2. Refresh the parent of the directory you expanded.

The sub directory has now been collapsed.

b'When trying to reproduce bug #164118
column8: I connected to a Solaris dstore-unix server. Selected a *.txt file in the "My Home" folder (/folk/mober)
column9: chose Right-click > Move.\n\nRSE curser turns into a sandclock and won\'t wake up again. After what seems like ages
column10: it brings up a dialog: "Move Resource
column11: Select Move destination".\n\nIn this dialog

column99: the Main thread is used for remote operations
column100: thus blocking all of Eclipse. Such operations need to be done in a background job with a progress monitor
column101: and they need to be cancelable in order to keep Eclipse responsive.\n\nI also think that the first issue (being so slow when opening the move destination dialog) is a regression
column102:
since I would have noticed this earlier otherwise. Thus marking as critical.

b'To reproduce
column8:
we used Windows with RSE 2.0.0.1.

Steps to reproduce:
- Expand Local Files node
- Create new filter:
    - Folder: C:\
    - Subset by file type: *.txt
    - Name: C:\
- Expand filters Drives->C:\ and C:\
- Expand a subfolder
- Create a set of new files like 123.txt
column9: 123.abc
column10:
123.uvw
- Select the folder and refresh (F5)

From now on
column11: it is unpredictable which content is shown for the same folder under the two different filters. We had combinations of showing the Drives->C:\\->subfolder the _filtered_ content of the C:\\ filter or one of the two folder shown no content or one or both folders show incomplete content ....\n\nThe expected behaviour is that even if the folder is the same element
column12: a refresh event for the folder needs still to refresh both instances
column13: the content (children) of the folder must be correct filtered and complete corresponding to the parent context.'

column7:
b'RSE I20070724-0735 on Linux or Windows:

Create a connection (I tested Linux-dstore and SSH Only).
Expand "Root" > / > /bin
No contents is shown.
Other folders below / only show sub directories but no files.
The error log does not show any exception.

With RSE 2.0.0.1 this worked correctly
column8:
and also RSE I20070719-1300 was OK.
This makes the candidate changes for this regression small:
   bug 197089 Need to set the filter when no separator in filter string
   bug 197484 Fix for SystemView to provide ContextObject on all levels

Supposedly as a side effect of this bug
column9: "Show in Table" is not available on expanded folders anywhere below the "Root" filter; it is available on collapsed folders and on any folders below "My Home".'

column7: b'Drill down a folder in the SystemView
column8: such that the list query throws an error.\nIn RSE 2.0
column9: this error message was shown as a child below the expanded folder.\n\nIn RSE 2.0.1RC1
column10: the error message is shown only very shortly
column11: then the\nparent of the folder is refreshed and so the error message is lost. The user has no chance to understand what went wrong
column12: and so he cannot react to the failure.\n\nTo reproduce easily
column13:
with ssh or dstore:
Open a shell on the remote
  mkdir $HOME/test
  mkdir $HOME/test/unreadable
  chmod 0 $HOME/test/unreadable
Now
column14: in RSE SystemView
column15: try to expand $HOME/test/unreadable.\nThe error is shown very quickly
column16:
then it is lost.

This is regression is probably due to the fix in bug 196662 comment 2.
I consider the issue major and since it is a regression compared to 2.0 we shoul d make all possible efforts to get it fixed.

column7: b"Now
column8: ServerLogger comes to have non-static methods to support a single-process server model.\nI've chosen EnvironmentMiner class as a place where the ServerLogger instance is created
column9:
since I thought that the EnvironmentMiner was always activated.
But the EnvironmentMiner is not activated when the USS facility is not constructed in a client and the client tries to connect to the server.  

So
column10: it seems that the org.eclipse.dstore.core project is the best place to make ServerLogger instance.\nBut
column11:
ServerLogger class belongs to org.eclipse.rse.dstore.universal.miners
of org.eclipse.rse.services.dstore project.
This project has dependence on org.eclipse.dstore.core project.
Due to cyclic dependency
column12: the class that belongs to org.eclipse.dstore.core project cannot invoke ServerLogger APIs.\n\nTo solve the above problem
column13: I think that the ServerLogger class should be moved from org.eclipse.rse.services.dstore project to org.eclipse.dstore.core project.\nAre there any solutions for this problem ?"

column7: b'We override the method SystemNewFilterWizard.createNamePage() to provide a wizard page of our own when creating a new filter. It seems the visibility of this method has been changed from protected to private recently
column8: which broke our code.\nIs there another way for us to override this wizard page?'

column7: b'Found while working on bug 235626:\n\nIn org.eclipse.rse.dstore.security plugin
column8: UniversalSecurityProperties
column9: externalized Strings are missing. This had not been discovered before
column10: because all of the Strings had been addressed incorrectly; this is now being fixed with bug 235626.\n\nI dreamed up some default messages for the missing PII Keys
column11:
but I think that these should really be replaced with the proper messages from existing IBM product(s). The missing keys are in UniversalSecurityProperties.properties:

# FIXME MISSING STRINGS START 
RESID_SECURITY_ALGORITHM_ERROR_     = Algorithm error in Keystore %1
RESID_SECURITY_LOAD_KEYSTORE_ERROR_ = An error occurred when processing Keystore.
RESID_SECURITY_KEY_LOAD_ERROR_      = Error loading key from %1
RESID_SECURITY_INITIALIZE_ERROR_    = Error initializing keystore at %1
RESID_SECURITY_SECURITY_PROVIDER_ERROR_ = Missing Security Provider
# FIXME MISSING STRINGS END 

Note again
column12: that the messages here were just dreamed up by me and are likely NOT correct. All messages can only occur in error messages; I did not check
column13: though
column14: under what circumstances the corresponding exceptions are thrown and/or if they even can ever get thrown.\n\nNote that before the fix from bug 235626
column15: existing behavior would have replaced the NLS MEssage with its key
column16:
so instead of a proper error message users would have read RESID_SECURITY_KEY_LOAD_ERROR without a message substitution.

column7:
b'Steps to reproduce:

1. Edit a file on a remote system. 
2. Click Save to save the new contents. DO NOT close the editor.
3. Restart the workbench with the file open.
4. When the workbench comes up
column8:
the file is still open.
5. Edit the file again and click Save.
6. RSE will prompt you to connect. Connect and allow the save.
7. Edit the file again and click Save.

A save conflict dialog pops up. I did some investigation...It seems that AFTER the upload
column9: when RSE queries for the last modified date of the remote file
column10: it still gets the old timestamp!!!\nRSE should wait for the timestamp to be updated before saving the timestamp for future use. At the moment
column11: there is an arbitrary sleep(1000) after which RSE queries for the new timestamp and assumes that this is the final value.'

column7: b'+++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #252794 +++\n\nProjects should leverage only published APIs of dependencies. As a Release Review requirement

column7: b'We do have a host type which can have 2 valid configuations for the file service subsystem
column8: SFTP and TCF. The used configuration will be switched either by the user or programatically. So far it basically works nicely except one leaves the session and restart Eclipse. On restart
column9:
the connection is not restored correctly:

1) _Both_ File service subsystem nodes are now visible under the connection

    MyConnection
        Sftp Files 
        Files

2) If the user left the session with TCF as active configuration
column10: after restart the active configuration is SFTP again. This might contribute to 1.\n\nSolving this problem is very critical for our product delivery.'

column7: b'After the server disconnects an idle client because the idle time exceeds DSTORE_IDLE_SHUTDOWN_TIMEOUT
column8: and before the client detects the disconnect
column9: if a client performs some operation
column10:
the client hangs.  There are at least 2 problems.

1. Disconnect on the server for an idle client is not reflected to the client immediately.  e.g. It takes 2 minutes.

2. StatusMonitor runs in the UI thread
column11: and ConnectionStatusListener.ConnectionDown is blocked.'

column7:
b"Accelerators don't work just after the page is changed in the editor which has 
multi-page.

The following is a example.

The editor is a subclass of MultiPageEditorPart.
Each of the pages has different scopes for key bindings.
And IKeyBindingService#setScopes and registerAction are called when the page 
is activated.
However
column8: the accelerators don't work
column9:
because the accelerators are updated in 
WWinKeyBindingService#updateAccelerators and this is called only when the part
(editor or view) is activated.

And this problem also happens
column10: if the editor has two panes and more and each \nof the panes has different scopes for key bindings."

column7: b'Using OptimizeIt
column8: each time I open and close the Debug launch configurations \ndialog
column9: 1 Shell is leaked
column10:
20 EnabledSubmission are leaked.

The shell is referenced as the active shell from the 20 EnabledSubmissions that 
remain in the enabledSubmissionsByContextId map of WorkbenchContextSupport.

On the close of the launch configuration
column11:
removeEnabledSubmissions is not 
called.

The submissions are added in checkWindowType(Shell) but since the shell is not 
registered
column12: no dispose listener is added and then the submissions are not \nremoved when the shell is disposed.'

column7:
b'The CommandCallback class that is stored as an instance var for the 
ExternalActionManager is leaking all of the IActionTextListeners that register. 

The listeners are not removed in the removeActionTextListener(*) method call.'

b'I200404281424

Sorry this bug report does not totally pinpoint the problem.

It would appear that not all HandlerSubmissions are getting removed from the 
WorkbenchCommandSupport or are staying around from the handlerSubmissions of 
the active workbench window. These in turn are hanging on to the 
ActionHandlers.

Test case:
Open a Java Editor using the File menu history
close the editor
<<GC using Optimize It>>
<<Mark the current instance count>>
Open a Java Editor using the File menu history
close the editor
<<GC using Optimize It>>

Most cases I am seeing up to 300 new ActionHandlers per editor (about 10k).'

b'The new looping code for thumbnail figure can throw NPEs.

paint can be called over and over on the thumbnail figure during a resize of a 
shell
column8: but async events are not dispatched until the user releases the mouse \nand finishes the resize of the Shell.  During this resize
column9: layouts and paints \nhappen over and over (the dock is changing size as well)
column10: and start() gets \ncalled multiple times because the thumbnail image gets thrown out over and \nover. start() places a Runnable on the async queue
column11: and these Runnables pile up \nif the user does a lengthy resize of the shell.  When you finally release the \nmouse
column12: the overview finished updating and stops
column13:
but then all of these starts() 
come in afterwards and try to access the source graphics.

NullPointer is at line 96.'

column7:
b'Steps:
- Open a Logic example diagram
- Press tab repeatedly until focus in on the palette.
- Use arrow keys to navigate to the connector tool and press enter.

Result:
- Can't continue editing with keyboard - have to transition to mouse to create 
a connector.

Expected result:
- Should be able to continue editing / creating connectors using keyboard only.

Newsgroup exerpt:

column8:
>

is there a keyboard accessible way to create
a

column12: \n> then set the focus back to the keyboard using "Tab"
column13:
but then the keyboard
> and/or arrows keys seem to be ignored?  Is there a key sequence to enter

column14: but then can\'t do\n> anything else via keyboard.\nIn 2.0

column9: I think'
